Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This is a blend of 80% Cabernet Franc, 10% Merlot and 10% Malbec. It's smooth and softened with age, yet still loaded with rich, ripe fruit. Blueberry, plum and black cherry combine in a deft and graceful wine, which spent two years in barrel. Subtle notes of herbs and tanned leather come through, along with coffee and chocolate. It's in perfect drinking condition and should remain there through 2024.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Quady North 2014 Arsenal Red (Applegate Valley)

Description: This is a hugely concentrated and powerful blend of 50% Cabernet Franc with 25% Merlot, 23% Cabernet Sauvignon and 2% Petit Verdot. Fresh and dried tobacco leaf, tomato and black pepper season a richness of plum and cassis, inspired by Bordeaux's Right Bank. Enjoy best from 2028 through 2035.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Cliff Lede 2018 High Fidelity Red (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Templeton Gap District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Loads of vibrantly spiced licorice and gingerbread aromas soak into the berry-jam tones on the nose of this blend of 75% Cabernet Sauvignon and 25% Malbec. It's rich and lavish on the palate, where layers of baked black currant, vanilla and caramel cream are balanced by decent acidity and firm tannins.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: ONX 2018 Caliber Red (Templeton Gap District)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Creamy aromas of blueberry, cassis, caramel and fudge meet with floral hints of violet and a subtle savoriness the nose of this blend of 85% Cabernet Sauvignon, 10% Cabernet Franc and 5% Petit Verdot. It's suave and lavish on the palate, loaded with jammy black-fruit, caramel and chocolate-mousse flavors, with a touch of espresso bean providing balance on the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Crown Point 2018 Relevant Red (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Appellation: Paso Robles Willow Creek District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Savory aromas of charred meat and black olive pick up a fruit aspect with scorched blueberry on the nose of this blend of 51% Merlot, 19% Cabernet Sauvignon, 14% Petite Sirah, 13% Petit Verdot and 3% Malbec. The roasted meat and fruit flavors hang on for the palate, where soy, pepper sauce and braised beef shank elements also show.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Jada Vineyard & Winery 2017 Strayts Red (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)

Description: Livermore Valley-based winemaker Collin Cranor has named this wine in homage to his pivot north to make wines from both Sonoma County and the Napa Valley. This Cabernet Sauvignon-based wine contains small amounts of Merlot and Cabernet Franc, blending it into a soft, supple and brightly rich and rounded expression of black cherry, toasted oak and baking spice.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Nottingham Cellars 2019 The Pivot Micro-Lot Reserve Red (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Clean lines of black cherry, root beer and cola make for an accessible blend of spice and fruit on the nose of this blend of 37% Cabernet Sauvignon, 36% Malbec and 27% Petit Verdot. The smooth integration carries into the sip, where morello cherry, dark-cocoa nibs and violet flavors coalesce.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Ragtag 2017 Meritage (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Tart elderberry aromas are sprinkled with damp herbs and crumpled purple flowers on the nose of this blend of 80% Cabernet Franc, 16% Merlot and 4% Petit Verdot. There is a rich, black-fruit core on the palate, but the herbal kicks of thyme, dried mint and peppercorn add elegance, while the milk-chocolate finish completes the lush wave.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Cloak & Dagger 2018 Deep State Red (Paso Robles)

Description: Muscular in dark cherry-cola and brown-sugar richness, this blend of 64% Cabernet Sauvignon with 20% Merlot, 10% Malbec and 6% Petit Verdot offers sultry intensity and verve. Toasted oak, tobacco and clove provide contrast and earthy complexity.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Stewart 2018 Tartan Red (Napa Valley)

Description: From a blend of 72% Cabernet Sauvignon and 28% Malbec, this blend spends time aging in both French and American oak. Flavors of mixed currants, earth and sage highlight a seamless palate that is both savory and fruity in spades.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Toybox Wine Cellars 2017 Field Trip Cadden Family Vineyard Red (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Côtes de Bergerac, Southwest France, France
Description: Powerfully rich and already balanced, this showcase wine from the estate is produced from the best parcels. It is rich, offering ripe black fruits, succulent acidity and a fine future. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Bélingard 2018 Ortus de Château Bélingard Red (Côtes de Bergerac)

Description: Rich and juicy, this is a well-balanced young wine. It has a great future as those tannins move away from center stage to allow space for the ripe black-plum and structured berry fruits. Give this wine plenty of time and drink from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Les Vignobles Saint Didier Parnac 2019 Château de Grézels Prestige  (Cahors)

Description: Rich and juicy, this is a well-balanced young wine. It has a great future as those tannins move away from center stage to allow space for the ripe black-plum and structured berry fruits. Give this wine plenty of time and drink from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Les Vignobles Saint Didier Parnac 2019 Château de Grézels Prestige  (Cahors)

Description: Robust in tannin, leather and cigar notes, this burly, full-bodied wine blends 70% Cabernet Sauvignon with 15% Merlot and 15% Cabernet Franc. Significant in power and concentration, it finishes in a layering of sage, dried herb and tobacco.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Darioush 2016 Sage Vineyard Red (Mount Veeder)

Description: A blend of Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon, this is a powerful, rich wine. The structure has now softened, giving perfumed and ripe black-fruit flavors. Touches of licorice and dark chocolate contrast the bold fruitiness. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Saint-Cernin 2017 No. 1 Saint-Cernin Red (Bergerac)

Description: This vintage of TD-9, named for the founder's favorite tractor, combines 56% Merlot, 23% Cabernet Sauvignon and 21% Malbec. Aromatic tones of rose and raspberry meet accents of cedar, tobacco leaf, iron and crushed rock, all while maintaining an intensely full-bodied, structured feel.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Shafer 2018 TD-9 Red (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Pleasantly mineral-driven aromas of crushed gravel and chipped slate meet with baked blackberry on the nose of this blend of 59% Cabernet Sauvignon, 23% Cabernet Franc, 13% Malbec and 5% Merlot. That rocky tension extends to the sip, where baked plum flavors also arise.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Kiamie 2017 Meritage (Adelaida District)

Appellation: Oak Knoll District, Napa, California, US
Description: A nearly equal blend of Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Malbec from the Vale Vineyard, this wine is perfumed, structured and nicely fruity, with an earthy backbone. Rich yet balanced, it shows a depth of flavor that never gets overly fussy.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Trail 3150 2018 Proprietary Red (Oak Knoll District)

Description: A blend of the two Cabernets, dominated by Cabernet Sauvignon, this single-vineyard, wood-aged wine, is spicy, perfumed with dense tannins and layers of black-currant fruit. With its fruit still full of energy, it is ready to drink. Organic.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de Bois-Brinçon 2015 Le Clos Bertin Red (Anjou)

Description: A bold, full-bodied blend of 58% Cabernet Sauvignon with 14% Malbec, 14% Cabernet Franc, 9% Merlot and 5% Petit Verdot, all grown biodynamically, this wine offers earthy cedar and tobacco. Hearty plum and cherry notes continue along the midpalate, accented in nutmeg and cola, the toasted oak lingering for awhile.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Benziger 2017 Tribute Estate Grown Red (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Moon Mountain District Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From the high-elevation appellation in the Mayacamas Mountains, this red is a blend of 53% Cabernet Franc, 22% Cabernet Sauvignon, 21% Petit Verdot and small amounts of Malbec and Merlot. Dark black fruit, anise and softened tannins make for a rich, rounded palate of moderate length and weight.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Kunde 2016 Red (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)

Description: A blend of half-and-half Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc, this wine shows plenty of structure. Still young it has considerable acidity as well as a firm, dry framework. It will develop well, the spicy fruits offering smoky richness. Drink the wine from 2022. Organic.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de Bois-Brinçon 2018 Le Clos des Cosses Red (Anjou Villages)

Description: This rich wine is powered by tannins and generous black-plum fruits. A concentrated wine, it has ripe berry flavors to balance the juicy acidity and solid, ageworthy structure. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Thénac 2018 Red (Bergerac)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A focused elderberry aroma melds with a hint of thyme on the nose of this blend of 73% Cabernet Sauvignon, 12% Merlot, 8% Cabernet Franc and 7% Petit Verdot. The dark purple-fruit flavors pick up a foral accent on the palate, where woody tannins impart some bitterness.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Kiamie 2016 Meritage (Adelaida District)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Freshly smashed blackberry, rich violet and sweet new leather aromas show on the nose of this blend. Black-plum and lavender flavors pop on the palate, where the acidity is strong and driving into the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Jalama 2018 Gaviota Red (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Made from 60% Merlot and 40% Cabernet Franc, this is a lovely, earthy and Old World style wine from a relatively cool site—the Merlot growing on the highest elevation block in the vineyard. With 14 months in French oak, 35% of it new, the wood profile is integrated and helps to accent the dried herb, cedar, pencil notes that dot soft, supple tannins.                      Virginie Boone
Designation: The Hill Windsor Oaks Micro-Lot Reserve
Name: Nottingham Cellars 2019 The Hill Windsor Oaks Micro-Lot Reserve Red (Russian River Valley)

Description: This is a brawny and earthy blend of 47% Merlot, 44% Cabernet Sauvignon, 4% Cabernet Franc, 3% Petit Verdot and 2% Malbec. Together, they offer a seamless core of oak and blue fruit in a serviceable, affordable package.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Kirkland Signature 2018 Red (Napa Valley)

Description: With its rich swathe of Cabernet Sauvignon, this wine has density and immense structure balanced by stunning black fruits that give impressive promise. This powerful wine is probably the greatest ever produced from this estate. Drink from 2027.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Figeac 2018  Saint-Émilion

Description: An immensely structured wine, this is complex, concentrated and yet so contained. The wine impresses with its balance, layers of succulent black-currant fruits and effortless style. A wine for the long term, it should not be touched before 2029.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Lafite Rothschild 2018  Pauillac

Description: This great estate in southern Pauillac, facing the Latour vineyard, is at the top of its game. In this release, the tannins are as impressive and dense as the black fruits. Together they form a harmonious ensemble, richly structured, concentrated from the many old vines in the blend, and very ageworthy. Drink from 2027.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Pichon Baron 2018  Pauillac

Description: Vintage 2018 was generous to the style of Ducru-Beaucaillou. The rich character of wines from this estate is enhanced by the ripeness and concentration of this wine. At the same time it keeps an amazing freshness that comes out of the acidity. This wine will go down in the annals of this historic estate. It is not likely to approach drinkability before 2028.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Ducru-Beaucaillou 2018  Saint-Julien

Description: Dense structure, powerful tannins and intense black fruits are contained within this wine that shows richness and sustained concentration as well as amazing freshness. The 86% Cabernet Sauvignon in the blend is the secret of this great wine that is sure to age magnificently. Don't think about drinking before 2029.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Mouton Rothschild 2018  Pauillac

Description: This dense wine is almost black in color. Offering tannins and luscious black fruits, it is ripe with both structure and richness. The concentration and thought-provoking intensity are impressive. Drink this wine from 2028. Organic and biodynamic.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Palmer 2018  Margaux

Description: This famous estate at the southern end of Pauillac has produced a powerful wine. Packed blackberry fruits, laced with acidity, are just starting out on a long journey along with the tannins. The wine's elegance is beautifully preserved within the structure. With considerable potential, the wine should not be drunk before 2027.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Pichon Longueville Comtesse de Lalande 2018  Pauillac
Winery: Château Pichon Longueville Comtesse de Lalande

Description: This wine combines the richness of the vintage with a sophisticated structure of smoky tannins and spicy wood aging. It is still young, with a powerful structure and ripe, vibrant black-currant fruits. The wine needs plenty of aging. Drink from 2028. Organic and biodynamic.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Pontet-Canet 2018  Pauillac

Description: The first thing that strikes about this wine is its massive density. The second is the richness of the structured Cabernet Franc that is such an important element in the blend. Weight is balanced by the intense fruits and amazing freshness of a wine that has such concentration. This wine will age for years. Don't touch it before 2027.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Cheval Blanc 2018  Saint-Émilion

Description: While this wine reflects the richness and density of the vintage, it also shows all the elegance of which a great Margaux is capable. The wine is powerful and beautifully structured, both ripe and restrained. It will age magnificently. Start to think about drinking from 2028.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Margaux 2018  Margaux

Description: The perfumes of this wine just pour from the glass. They measure up to the promise of the black tannins and dark, dense fruits, the monumental structure and juicy black-plum flavors. The whole ethos of this wine is towards long-term aging to great power and intensity for the future. Drink from 2028.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Ausone 2018  Saint-Émilion

Description: This wine confirms the place of Montrose among the top Bordeaux estates. With its rich tannins and powerful structure, it exudes concentration and density. But the wine also shows a sense of style. Fruit purity will make it impressive and allow it to age for many years. Drink this wine from 2028.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Montrose 2018  Saint-Estèphe

Description: In this wine, fine and rich tannins partner with powerful black-plum and black-currant fruits. Densely textured while also having swathes of rich fruits, the wine shows both a firm side and one that offers total deliciousness. As it matures, both these aspects will come together. Drink from 2027.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Léoville Barton 2018  Saint-Julien

Description: Warm-hearted and rich with black-plum and dark-chocolate flavors, this wine comes from one of the properties owned by the Chanel luxury group. The dense tannins and generous fruits are typical of wines from this top estate. Drink from 2027.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Rauzan-Ségla 2018  Margaux

Description: This is a dense, generous wine. Swathes of black fruits are packed with concentrated tannins. Its power is palpable, as is its luxuriously rich future. The wine will take plenty of aging, so don't drink before 2027.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Calon Ségur 2018  Saint-Estèphe

Description: Dense layers of black fruits mingle with dusty tannins in this wine. The powerful structure is beautifully balanced with ripe fruitiness in harmony with the concentration of the wine's texture. This wine will age well. Drink from 2027.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Bélair-Monange 2018  Saint-Émilion

Description: This impressive estate has produced another fine wine. Structured, powered by tannins as much as by great fruit, this wine is set for a long aging process. The fruit shows massive concentration, enhanced by succulent acidity and bolstered by those tannins that show so strongly. It's a wine for great patience, so wait to drink until 2027.                      Roger Voss
Name: Clos Fourtet 2018  Saint-Émilion

Description: This estate is on a roll. Replete with powerful tannins and dense black fruits, this latest release continues the succession of fine vintages. Perfumed, ripe with berry flavors and, more importantly, with rich tannins, the wine will age impressively. Drink from 2027.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château la Gaffelière 2018  Saint-Émilion

Description: Richly dense and impressively concentrated, this is a powerful wine. Swathes of black fruits show off the Cabernet structure and dark, ageworthy character of this wine. Drink the wine from 2027.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Léoville Poyferré 2018  Saint-Julien

Description: This release continues the great run of vintages from this estate, based in the eastern part of Saint-Emilion. Powerful tannins are echoed by sumptuous black-plum and berry flavors. The high alcohol shows in the density although this concentrated wine does stay comfortably in balance. It needs plenty of aging. Don't drink before 2027.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Valandraud 2018  Saint-Émilion

Description: This opulent wine is as bold with its fruit as with its tannins. The initial velvet texture masks the dense structure that will allow it to age impressively. Blackberry flavors, acidity and intense richness are coming together in a welter of ripe fruits. Drink from 2026.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Clerc Milon 2018  Pauillac

Description: A decade ago, this estate was in a fallow period, but its wines live up to their terroir. Solid tannins give it dryness and hint at the classic black-currant fruits to come. At the moment, the wine is just starting out, but its elements promise good aging. Drink from 2027.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Trottevieille 2018  Saint-Émilion

Description: This opulent wine is as bold with its fruit as with its tannins. The initial velvet texture masks the dense structure that will allow it to age impressively. Blackberry flavors, acidity and intense richness are coming together in a welter of ripe fruits. Drink from 2026.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Clerc Milon 2018  Pauillac

Description: Te Mata's top wine comes mostly from the Havelock Hills, the first legally protected vineyards in New Zealand. This vintage is a strong one, showcasing the power and ageability of a world class red with the precision and linearity of this traditional estate. Notes of black currant, plum, black olive, baking spice, dried green herbs and vanillin and chocolaty oak are present throughout. Chalky tannins are taut and powerful but well-integrated, hinting at a long life ahead. Drink 2022–2040.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Te Mata 2018 Coleraine Red (Hawke's Bay)

Description: An oasis of green, this grand estate within the Bordeaux suburbs has produced a powerful, massively textured wine. It also has the fruit richness to partner the structure along with a fresher streak of acidity. The wine will age, so drink from 2026.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Pape Clément 2018  Pessac-Léognan

Description: Rich and dense, this wine is happily poised between ripe fruits and a deceptively powerful structure. Smoky flavors from wood aging combine with solid black fruits that strain but never overstep an impressive balance. This wine will age, promising much for the future. Drink from 2026.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Cos d'Estournel 2018  Saint-Estèphe

Description: This is a generous, full-bodied wine. Touches of vanilla indicate the wood aging but that will go as the elegant structure and black fruits come to the fore. The wine's future is assured, promising impressive drinking from 2027.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Kirwan 2018  Margaux

Description: This is a generous, full-bodied wine. Touches of vanilla indicate the wood aging but that will go as the elegant structure and black fruits come to the fore. The wine's future is assured, promising impressive drinking from 2027.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Kirwan 2018  Margaux

Description: Situated on some of the finest terroir in Pomerol, this estate has produced a powerful while impressively subtle wine. Black fruits, rich tannins and strength come together in a wine that is much more than its elements. Aging will bring out the wine's character. Drink from 2027.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château la Fleur-Pétrus 2018  Pomerol

Description: The balance between Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon in this wine gives it swathes of rich fruit and a classic structure. Blackberry flavors layered with firm, dense tannins convey elegance and richness. This is a ripe wine, generously proportioned and ready for aging.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Haut-Bailly 2018  Pessac-Léognan

Description: Despite its weight, this is a well-crafted wine. It combines richness with sophisticated tannins, dense black fruits and considerable potential. Ripe berry flavors give depth. Drink this wine from 2026.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Malartic-Lagravière 2018  Pessac-Léognan

Description: This is a great estate performing at its best. In this latest release, massive tannins give black-plum fruits concentration and layers of spice and licorice flavors. The wine is set for long-term aging and certainly should not be touched before 2027.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Trotanoy 2018  Pomerol

Description: This is now performing as one of the top Margaux estates. Their latest release shows structure, elegant black fruits and rich tannins. Densely textured and vibrantly fruity, the wine has a fine future. Drink from 2027.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Brane-Cantenac 2018  Margaux

Description: The second wine of Château Ausone, always produced in limited quantities, provides a fine echo of the top wine. Bold tannins and fine perfumes give this wine richness and excellent potential. Layers of black fruits are impeccable, right in the balance with the wine's texture. This will certainly age, drinkable from 2026.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Ausone 2018 Chapelle d'Ausone  (Saint-Émilion)

Description: Big, rich and packed with smoky black fruits, this is not a shy wine. Dark chocolate and black-plum flavors mingle with the solid structure and concentrated tannins. With its ripe, juicy fruitiness at the end, the wine has all the elements in place. Let it age and drink from 2027.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Beau-Séjour Bécot 2018  Saint-Émilion

Description: Always a significant wine, this latest release with powerful while also stylish black fruits fits into a well-regarded tradition. The density and broad fruitiness of the wine make fine foils for each other. It is firmly structured and set for aging. Drink this wine from 2027.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Giscours 2018  Margaux

Description: This wine offers rich licorice and blackberry flavors as well as freshness. It has structure and power while also showing fruitiness and acidity that offer poise. The wine's long-term future is assured. Drink from 2026. Organic and biodynamic.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Smith Haut Lafitte 2018  Pessac-Léognan

Description: In the style of this estate, this lush wine is full of dry botrytis as well as ripe, honeyed marmalade and tangerine freshness. It is beautifully textured, the botrytis fully integrated and giving texture. The wine will age. Wait to drink until 2025.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de Rayne Vigneau 2018  Sauternes

Description: Ripe black fruits shine through this balanced wine, showing strongly against a backdrop of rich, generous tannins. This estate is one to watch as it achieves the form the vineyard deserves. Expect this wine to be ready to drink from 2026.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Cantenac Brown 2018  Margaux

Description: Villa Maria's top red, a Cabernet Sauvignon-dominant Bordeaux blend, is named for the Maori word for gravel, referring to its famed Gimblett Gravels soils. This is a wine made for the long haul although even now, with ample time open in bottle or decanter, reveals finesse and character. The fruit is dark and fleshy with a spine of leafy green herbs, violet, tomato stem and baking spice. The palate is satiny yet toned and elegant, with linear, taut tannins, and currently quite a lot of oak influence. A worthy addition to any red-lover's cellar. Drink 2025–2045.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Villa Maria 2018 Ngakirikiri Red (Hawke's Bay)

Description: From the partner estate to Château Giscours, this wine is as elegant as you would expect. While it is structured, it also has ripe fruits, rich tannins and great potential. The dry and firm core of this wine will propel it forward. Drink from 2027.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château du Tertre 2018  Margaux

Description: This is a ripe, classic Cabernet Sauvignon-based wine. Its strict initial character blossoms out into rich black-currant flavors that exude class. Backed by acidity and with hints of the wood aging still in place, the wine is just beginning its journey. Drink from 2027.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Duhart-Milon 2018  Pauillac

Description: Beautifully textured and rich in black-currant flavors and tannins, this is a generous wine. The fruits and the dusty tannins partner each other well giving structure, concentration, a sense of poise and final freshness. Drink this wine from 2026.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Langoa Barton 2018  Saint-Julien

Description: Owned by the Kressmann family, this estate has released an ageworthy wine. Rich tannins are balanced by dark, juicy blackberry fruits and dense, concentrated tannins. The wine needs to age, so drink from 2026.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Latour-Martillac 2018  Pessac-Léognan

Description: This estate, backing on to Château Cheval Blanc, has produced an intensely structured wine also full of rich fruits. It has the weight and density typical of this warm vintage, giving a powerhouse of black fruit and structure. Drink from 2026.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château la Dominique 2018  Saint-Émilion

Description: Ripe and spicy with blueberry fruits and rich tannins, this wine is just setting out on its long journey. One of the properties owned by the Lurton family in Pessac-Léognan, the wine balanced, with acidity and fruits allied to tannins. Drink from 2026.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château la Louvière 2018  Pessac-Léognan

Description: For its weight, this wine is also elegant. Rich, lush Merlot fruit flavors have a sense of restraint, self-contained and already delicious. The ripe berry flavors promise a wine that will have opulent fruit as well as structure. Drink from 2026.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Gazin 2018  Pomerol

Description: This is an excellent bottling of Awatea, the younger brother of Te Mata's top red, Coleraine. From a long, warm growing season, this feels like a complete wine. Winter warming notes of plump plums, dark cherries and chocolate are complemented by a bounty of dried herbs, spices and graphite. The palate is similarly dense and structured but with elegance and balance. Tannins are powdery and fine, winding through dark, tangy fruit and herbs. Like many of Te Mata's wines, it has an old school Bordeaux vibe that will appeal more to some than to others.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Te Mata 2018 Awatea Red (Hawke's Bay)

Description: A deceptively smooth texture and black fruits hide a wine that has great density and richness. Firm tannins lie beneath the ripeness. They will allow this wine to age, giving future concentration and depth. Drink the wine from 2027.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Branaire-Ducru 2018  Saint-Julien

Description: This is a powerful, densely structured wine. Rich in tannins, full of dark black fruits and ripe acidity, the wine is impressively complete. It has considerable promise. Drink this wine from 2026.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Clinet 2018  Pomerol

Description: This small property has produced a surprisingly restrained, stylish wine for its great richness. Ripe tannins showcase the black-currant fruits, with the perfumed Cabernet Franc balanced by dense Merlot in a harmonious whole. This is a wine to age. Drink from 2027.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Hosanna 2018  Pomerol

Description: A deceptively smooth texture and black fruits hide a wine that has great density and richness. Firm tannins lie beneath the ripeness. They will allow this wine to age, giving future concentration and depth. Drink the wine from 2027.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Branaire-Ducru 2018  Saint-Julien

Description: This is a powerful, densely structured wine. Rich in tannins, full of dark black fruits and ripe acidity, the wine is impressively complete. It has considerable promise. Drink this wine from 2026.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Clinet 2018  Pomerol

Description: This wine comes from an estate that is performing with distinction. It is rich, the tannins cushioned by ripe blackberry fruits and good acidity. Showing both structure and fruitiness, the wine will develop well, everything in balance. Drink from 2026.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Lafon-Rochet 2018  Saint-Estèphe

Description: This second wine of Château Margaux, grand in its own right, is powerfully dense. It displays its own style and balance between rich black fruits and the acidity that shines through the structure. The wine will age well, its ripeness and concentration likely to soften as it matures. Drink from 2026.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Margaux 2018 Pavillon Rouge du Château Margaux  (Margaux)

Description: This wine shows the generous richness of the vintage while restraining it with fine tannins and pure black-currant acidity. The structure and fruits promise long-term aging. Drink this wine from 2027.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Prieuré-Lichine 2018  Margaux

Description: From an estate in the southern part of Margaux, this wine has just the right mix of rich tannins and taut black-currant flavors to give upfront freshness and potential for further aging. Structured and fruity, it should be drunk from 2027.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Siran 2018  Margaux

Description: The vineyard, on the edge of Saint-Emilion city, has produced a juicy, well-structured wine. Restrained tannins back up ripe black-currant fruitiness. An attractive smoky perfume from rich Cabernet Franc in the blend enhances complexity and density. Drink the wine from 2026.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château la Couspaude 2018  Saint-Émilion

Description: The second wine of Lafite Rothschild is itself grand. Dense tannins allied to the juicy fruits are the starting point for controlled richness, tight freshness, a powerful structure and considerable potential. Drink from 2027.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Lafite Rothschild 2018 Carruades de Lafite  (Pauillac)

Description: This large estate to the north of Margaux village is performing well. There is still a tendency to overuse wood aging, but powerful black fruits will provide balance as the wine ages. With its structure and dark tannins, this wine has a long-term perspective. Drink from 2027.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Lascombes 2018  Margaux

Description: Owned by the Rothschild family of Lafite-Rothschild, this estate has produced a richly delicious wine. The power of Merlot is tempered and perfumed by ripe Cabernet Franc. Tannins and acidity both point to aging potential. The wine's weight, cut with black fruits, is just right and well in balance. This wine needs time, so drink from 2027.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château l'Évangile 2018  Pomerol

Description: The estate is surrounded by the suburbs of the city of Libourne and this wine is produced by the team at Château Cheval Blanc. That combination has produced a sequence of fine wines, like this release. Rich fruits have been given a sheen of wood aging and crafted tannins to make a wine that will age well. Drink from 2026.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Quinault L'Enclos 2018  Saint-Émilion

Description: A well-constructed wine that is ripe with black fruits and integrated tannins, this is in a good place for aging. Black-currant fruitiness is balanced by a dry, smoky core that holds promise. Drink this wine from 2026.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Cantemerle 2018  Haut-Médoc

Description: This large estate to the north of Margaux village is performing well. There is still a tendency to overuse wood aging, but powerful black fruits will provide balance as the wine ages. With its structure and dark tannins, this wine has a long-term perspective. Drink from 2027.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Lascombes 2018  Margaux

Description: Owned by the Rothschild family of Lafite-Rothschild, this estate has produced a richly delicious wine. The power of Merlot is tempered and perfumed by ripe Cabernet Franc. Tannins and acidity both point to aging potential. The wine's weight, cut with black fruits, is just right and well in balance. This wine needs time, so drink from 2027.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château l'Évangile 2018  Pomerol

Description: The estate is surrounded by the suburbs of the city of Libourne and this wine is produced by the team at Château Cheval Blanc. That combination has produced a sequence of fine wines, like this release. Rich fruits have been given a sheen of wood aging and crafted tannins to make a wine that will age well. Drink from 2026.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Quinault L'Enclos 2018  Saint-Émilion

Description: This estate is continuing its rise under the tutelage of the Vauthier family of Château Ausone. With firm tannins, dark black fruits, smoky flavors and touches of spice, the wine will need time. Drink from 2026.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château la Clotte 2018  Saint-Émilion

Description: Dominated by Cabernet Sauvignon, this is one of a pair of second wines from this estate. With its classic Pauillac black-currant flavors and dense tannins, the wine is a slow developer. By 2025, it should show great fruits and a balanced texture.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Pichon Baron 2018 Les Griffons de Pichon Baron  (Pauillac)

Description: While this wine is rich, it also has style and delicious potential. Blackberry fruits and touches of wood aging show it is still young. These will work together well as the wine matures and give a ripe wine full of Merlot fruits that's ready to drink from 2025.                      Roger Voss
Name: Clos des Jacobins 2018  Saint-Émilion

Description: This smoky wine still shows some wood aging flavors. Structure comes from this wood aging as well as the rich blackberry-fruit tannins and concentration. The succulent Cabernet Sauvignon is ripe and full. It needs time, so drink from 2026.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Lagrange 2018  Saint-Julien

Description: Black fruits and tannins combine well in this structured wine. There is a succulent character to the fruit, with acidity and a fresh aftertaste working together. Still young, the wine should be ready from 2026                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Larrivet Haut-Brion 2018  Pessac-Léognan

Description: The estate is under the same ownership as Château Lynch-Bages in Pauillac. Rich and smoky, this sophisticated, rich wine has some serious tannins as well as black fruits. The wine shows great pedigree, with dark berry fruits and a firm, ageworthy structure. Drink from 2026.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château les Ormes de Pez 2018  Saint-Estèphe

Description: The effort that has gone into improving this estate is paying off. A wine like this allows the château to take its rightful classed growth place. Full of rich tannins, the wine also has the stylishness of a Margaux with a fine line of black-currant fruits and a ripe texture. Drink from 2026.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Rauzan-Gassies 2018  Margaux

Description: With vines to the east of Saint-Emilion city, this wine is rich and solid with tannins, with a powerfully pure line of acidity and black fruits. The wine will age and should be ready to drink from 2026.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Sanctus 2018  Saint-Émilion

Description: The second wine of Château Cheval Blanc, this is rich and structured in its own right. It offers powerful tannins as well as ripe, smoky fruitiness. Blackberry flavors vie with structured richness, always keeping a center of freshness. The wine will age well and should not be drunk before 2026.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Cheval Blanc 2018 Le Petit Cheval  (Saint-Émilion)

Description: With vines to the east of Saint-Emilion city, this wine is rich and solid with tannins, with a powerfully pure line of acidity and black fruits. The wine will age and should be ready to drink from 2026.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Sanctus 2018  Saint-Émilion

Description: This wine has all the structured intensity and ripe fruitiness of a Saint-Julien. At the same time, it displays a light touch with the black fruits and open texture, promising an attractive wine. Drink the wine from 2026.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Gloria 2018  Saint-Julien

Description: A densely textured and rich wine, this has power and concentration. Smoky tannins show strongly as well as juicy black-currant fruits that are still young. The wine, with its structure, is just starting on a journey to aging. Drink from 2027.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Gruaud Larose 2018  Saint-Julien

Description: With the arrival of the next generation, this estate has begun to achieve its real potential. The result is this powerfully impressive wine, solid with tannins as well as perfumed black fruits and a solid, ageworthy structure. Drink this wine from 2027. Organic and biodynamic.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Guadet 2018  Saint-Émilion

Description: This powerful, structured wine is packed with the ripest Merlot, with magnificent tannins and dark-plum flavors. Freshness shines through all this density, giving the wine considerable aging potential. Drink this rich wine from 2026.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Latour à Pomerol 2018  Pomerol

Description: The second wine of Château Montrose is a major star in its own right. With dense tannins and concentrated black fruits, it has power and richness. The wine's potential, impressive for a second wine, is very evident in the structure. Drink from 2026.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Montrose 2018 La Dame de Montrose  (Saint-Estèphe)

Description: With the arrival of the next generation, this estate has begun to achieve its real potential. The result is this powerfully impressive wine, solid with tannins as well as perfumed black fruits and a solid, ageworthy structure. Drink this wine from 2027. Organic and biodynamic.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Guadet 2018  Saint-Émilion

Description: This powerful, structured wine is packed with the ripest Merlot, with magnificent tannins and dark-plum flavors. Freshness shines through all this density, giving the wine considerable aging potential. Drink this rich wine from 2026.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Latour à Pomerol 2018  Pomerol

Description: The second wine of Château Montrose is a major star in its own right. With dense tannins and concentrated black fruits, it has power and richness. The wine's potential, impressive for a second wine, is very evident in the structure. Drink from 2026.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Montrose 2018 La Dame de Montrose  (Saint-Estèphe)

Description: The special bottle celebrates 100 years of ownership by the Cordier family, one of the top Bordeaux wine families.This wine shows concentration and intense black fruits. Rich dark chocolate and a luscious texture are allied to the firm base of tannins. The wine is set for aging. Drink from 2027.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Talbot 2018  Saint-Julien

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Cabernet Sauvignon comprises 55% of this wine, with the balance Merlot (24%), Cabernet Franc (11%), and then equal parts Malbec and Petit Verdot. The fruit flavors show sophistication. It's packed tightly with youthful tannins, acidity and notes of cherry, black tea, raspberry and spice. It will have a very long life ahead of it. Drink 2030–2040.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: L'Ecole No. 41 2018 Ferguson Vineyard Estate Grown Red (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Description: This estate at the western edge of Pauillac is beginning to show its potential. Powerful and dense, this wine offers concentrated black fruits and tannins that are solid and dry. The wine has a firm character, full bodied and with a long-term future. Drink from 2026.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Batailley 2018  Pauillac

Description: The second wine of Château Figeac, this reflects the top wine's chiseled structure and firm tannins, rich in black currant and damson fruits. The tannins and vanilla flavors give the wine sweetness, echoed by the generous fruits. Drink from 2025.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Figeac 2018 Le Petit Figeac  (Saint-Émilion)

Description: This powerful, Merlot-dominated wine is densely textured and concentrated. Powerful, dark fruits are as intense as the tannins, offering huge richness. For contrast, fresher acidity shoots through the wine, adding to the ageworthy promise. Drink from 2025.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château la Croix de Gay 2018  Pomerol

Description: From one of the southernmost Médoc estates, close to the city of Bordeaux, this wine is structured, rich in black fruits and solidly dense. Yet with all this density and power, it has a sense of texture, elegance and sophistication that comes from Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink the wine from 2026. Organic.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château La Lagune 2018 Les Cabernets Sauvignons  (Haut-Médoc)

Description: Named after the remains of a church that stands on the edge of Saint-Emilion, this wine is rich and dense. It is also stylish, as you would expect from a wine produced by neighboring Clos Fourtet. Black-currant flavors along with powerful tannins and acidity will allow the wine to age. Drink from 2027.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château les Grandes Murailles 2018  Saint-Émilion

Description: This estate has steadily gained in quality and this latest release is one of its best. With good balance between black-currant fruits and a sophisticated structure, the wine has a great future. The dominance of Cabernet Sauvignon in the blend will allow it to age. Drink from 2026.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Lynch-Moussas 2018  Pauillac

Description: From the vineyard that surrounds one of the grandest chateaux in Saint-Emilion, this wine brings richness, complexity and density. A blend that unusually includes Cabernet Sauvignon and Malbec, it is a structured, firm wine that emphasizes tannins as much as the black-currant fruits. It will be ready from 2026.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Soutard 2018  Saint-Émilion

Description: This estate has steadily gained in quality and this latest release is one of its best. With good balance between black-currant fruits and a sophisticated structure, the wine has a great future. The dominance of Cabernet Sauvignon in the blend will allow it to age. Drink from 2026.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Lynch-Moussas 2018  Pauillac

Description: From the vineyard that surrounds one of the grandest chateaux in Saint-Emilion, this wine brings richness, complexity and density. A blend that unusually includes Cabernet Sauvignon and Malbec, it is a structured, firm wine that emphasizes tannins as much as the black-currant fruits. It will be ready from 2026.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Soutard 2018  Saint-Émilion

Description: A ripe, juicy wine with great freshness and swathes of black-currant fruits, this is already delicious. Plenty of tannins back up the fruits and push the wine towards a rich future, but the balance is already there. Drink this wine from the Mouton-Rothschild stable from 2025.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château d'Armailhac 2018  Pauillac

Description: This well-balanced wine is ripe, with dense black fruits shot through with ageworthy tannins. Poised and already offering fruitiness and ripeness built for long-term aging, this wine will be ready from 2026. Organic and biodynamic.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Fonplégade 2018  Saint-Émilion

Description: A rich, perfumed wine, this has ripe black-fruit and vanilla flavors. Dense tannins from both from the wood and the fruit add spice and smokiness to this full wine. The firmness needs to soften into the fruit, so wait to drink until 2026.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Grand Mayne 2018  Saint-Émilion

Description: The vineyards surrounding the 12th-century castle have produced this rich and densely structured wine. Powerful tannins give a smoky character to the ripe, black-plum fruits. It definitely needs aging, so drink from 2026.                      Roger Voss
Name: Chateau La Tour Carnet 2018  Haut-Médoc

Description: From one of the estates owned by the Vauthier family of Château Ausone, this wine is rich, both in fruit and tannic structure. Ripeness and power are balanced by elegant fruits. Drink the wine from 2026.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Moulin Saint-Georges 2018  Saint-Émilion

Description: With its structure balanced by textured black-currant fruits and acidity, this is an attracrtive second wine. Poise and freshness are matched by the tannins and dry core. Drink the wine from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Pape Clément 2018 Clémentin de Pape Clément  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: Now on a roll, this estate is producing some fine wines. This latest release shows plenty of wood at this stage, but the bold black fruits are more than a match, giving the wine sumptuous richness. The wine needs time, so wait until 2026.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Phélan-Ségur 2018  Saint-Estèphe

Description: One of the two second wines from this estate, this is dominated by Merlot, giving a rounded, jammy character that is comfortably filled out with generous tannins. With chocolate and spice flavors, the wine is developing well. Drink from 2025.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Pichon Baron 2018 Les Tourelles de Longueville  (Pauillac)

Description: A well-textured, smooth and rich wine, this is powerful while also retaining great elegance. It is a black-fruited, dense wine, shot through with acidity and with a well rounded profile. Drink this blend of 90% Merlot with Cabernet Franc from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Plincette 2018  Pomerol

Description: This is a big-hearted wine, ripe with both black-plum flavors and generous tannins. At this stage the structure is prominent, but with the weight of the fruits, the wine will balance out full, ripe and ready to drink from 2026.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Poujeaux 2018  Moulis-en-Médoc

Description: This is a big-hearted wine, ripe with both black-plum flavors and generous tannins. At this stage the structure is prominent, but with the weight of the fruits, the wine will balance out full, ripe and ready to drink from 2026.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Poujeaux 2018  Moulis-en-Médoc

Description: Big tannins and rich berry fruits are a reminder that this estate made one of the original garage wines. Things have become more classic perhaps, but the dense richness of blackberry fruits and tannins and beautiful precision remain. Drink the wine from 2025.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Rol Valentin 2018  Saint-Émilion

Description: A blend of 35% Cabernet Franc, 33% Merlot and 32% Cabernet Sauvignon from the UC Davis Oakville Station vineyard, this is a smooth and sultry wine from a place that is well-drained and warm. Juicy with a backbone of structure, it has dried herb, cedar and pencil notes that accent a powerfully built fruity core of blackberry and cherry, finishing in baking spice and leather.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Cornerstone 2017 Oakville Station Red (Oakville)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot isn't ready to reveal its charms at present, with subdued notes of café au lait, dried herbs, moist earth, raspberry and cherry. The palate displays the winery's reserved style, with the exquisite balance of the vintage on full display. Best after 2028.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Seven Hills Winery 2018 Ciel du Cheval Red (Red Mountain)

Description: This is a stylish wine, ripe with black fruits and tannins that show restraint despite the high alcohol. Moving towards integration and with great black-currant fruits, the wine has considerable potential. Drink from 2027.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château la Grave Trigant de Boisset 2018  Pomerol
Winery: Château la Grave Trigant de Boisset

Description: Rich with smoky flavors and tastes of wood aging, this wine is just starting out. The fruit is certainly there, lush black-plum flavors supported by a core of dense tannins. With its richness and potential, the wine needs time. Drink from 2025.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château le Bon Pasteur 2018  Pomerol

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Merlot (46%) and Cabernet Franc (42%) take the lead, with bits of Cabernet Sauvignon and Petit Verdot finishing it off. The aromas bring immediate appeal, with notes of leafy herbs and chocolate-covered cherry. A full-bodied, action-packed palate follows. There's density and richness as well as plenty of finely combed tannins and bright acidity. It brings an impressive seamlessness.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Baer 2017 Ursa Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: In this ripe, classic wine, the tannins and black-currant fruit are equally important. Warm tannins are underlined by the fruitiness and richness of Cabernet Sauvignon, giving the wine a fine, medium-term future. Drink from 2025. Organic.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Angludet 2018  Margaux

Description: The second wine of Chäteau Calon Ségur, this is luscious and massively dense, with black-plum fruits backed by velvet tannins and acidity. It shows power along with good potential for aging. Drink from 2026.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Calon Ségur 2018 Le Marquis de Calon Ségur  (Saint-Estèphe)

Description: Offering structure as well as black-currant fruits, this wine is already balanced. It has fruit weight, the succulent Merlot balanced by complex Cabernet Sauvignon in the blend. A wine with a good future, this should be ready from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de France 2018  Pessac-Léognan

Description: The second wine of this estate, formerly La Parde de Haut-Bailly, is a good reflection of the top wine. Firm tannins are embellished by black fruits that give richness and density. While tannins are there, the wine is generously textured and set for great medium-term aging. Drink from 2025.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Haut-Bailly 2018 Haut-Bailly II  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: Produced by the d'Arfeuille family, this wine is densely tannic while also perfumed from the Cabernet Franc in the blend. It has a strong presence, black fruits and a solid dry core promising aging potential. Drink this powerful wine from 2026.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château La Serre 2018  Saint-Émilion

Description: Produced by the d'Arfeuille family, this wine is densely tannic while also perfumed from the Cabernet Franc in the blend. It has a strong presence, black fruits and a solid dry core promising aging potential. Drink this powerful wine from 2026.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château La Serre 2018  Saint-Émilion

Description: This vineyard operated on organic principles has produced a firm, solidly structured wine. It is dense, full of tannins as much as black-currant fruits. All the elements are just beginning to come together. Drink from 2026.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château La Tour Figeac 2018  Saint-Émilion

Description: This well-structured wine shows both richness and tension. Black-currant fruitiness is balanced by a mineral texture that gives the wine a taut, structured edge that contrasts with the juicy fruits. This suggests the wine will age well. Drink from 2026.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Picque Caillou 2018  Pessac-Léognan

Description: This estate bordering Margaux has produced a rich, well-balanced wine. Classic black-currant flavors shine, with tannins playing a major supporting part. With its succulent texture and ripe fruits, the wine should age well over the medium term. Drink from 2025.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Belgrave 2018  Haut-Médoc

Description: Owned by a branch of the Rothschild family since 1973, this is a major estate in Listrac. Rich in black fruits and dense with ripe tannins, the wine is a 70/30 Merlot/Cabernet Sauvignon blend, reflected in the rounded texture that cushions the structure. Drink from 2025.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Clarke 2018  Listrac-Médoc

Description: This is sumptuously textured, rich wine with generous black fruits. Its structure and jammy blackberry flavors promise ripeness and richness for the future. With its tannins lying under the fruit, it should develop relatively quickly. Drink from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Haut-Bergey 2018  Pessac-Léognan

Description: Made from young vines, this second wine of Mouton Rothschild was, unusually, aged in 100% new wood. While that does show as a vanilla edge to the wine, the ripe black fruits are moving forward to give richness and density. Drink the wine from 2025.                      Roger Voss
Designation: Le Petit Mouton de Mouton Rothschild
Name: Château Mouton Rothschild 2018 Le Petit Mouton de Mouton Rothschild  (Pauillac)

Description: After many years of work, this has become one of the top Médoc estates. This release is well balanced, rich in both tannins and black-currant fruits. It has a fine future with its acidity and fresh aftertaste. Drink from 2025.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Preuillac 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Médoc)

Description: This estate bordering Margaux has produced a rich, well-balanced wine. Classic black-currant flavors shine, with tannins playing a major supporting part. With its succulent texture and ripe fruits, the wine should age well over the medium term. Drink from 2025.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Belgrave 2018  Haut-Médoc

Description: Owned by a branch of the Rothschild family since 1973, this is a major estate in Listrac. Rich in black fruits and dense with ripe tannins, the wine is a 70/30 Merlot/Cabernet Sauvignon blend, reflected in the rounded texture that cushions the structure. Drink from 2025.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Clarke 2018  Listrac-Médoc

Description: The firm tannins that characterize a wine from Listrac are balanced in this wine by ripe black fruits. It is full and spicy, with the wood aging just showing in the smoky edge of this ageworthy wine. Drink from 2025.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Fourcas Hosten 2018  Listrac-Médoc

Description: Although this wine shows plenty of obvious wood aging at this stage, the structured Cabernet Sauvignon, good acidity and black-currant flavors promise an excellent future. The wine has a firm edge, great freshness and a final spicy aftertaste. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Haut Queyran 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Médoc)

Description: This is a dark, dense wine, with its tannins very much intact. Under the powerful structure, there are hints of the rich black fruits that are likely to develop as the wine matures. It will need some time, so wait to drink until 2025.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Petit Village 2018  Pomerol

Description: The Audoy family has produced a structured wine, dense with tannins and backed by dark plum and berry fruits. It is rich, with a good future ahead of it, textured with richness as well as initial dryness. Drink the wine from 2026.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Cos Labory 2018  Saint-Estèphe

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Consisting of the five main Bordeaux varieties, this wine has aromas that are immediately approachable, with notes of raspberry, cedar, freshly harvested herbs and cherry. There's plenty of balance and freshness to the flavors. Best after 2025.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Seven Hills Winery 2017 Pentad Red (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Description: Powerful fruits and tannins show densely in this concentrated wine. It is all about structured black fruits that are still young and vibrant with freshness among the ripe flavors. The wine needs to smooth out, so wait until 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Grand Corbin 2018  Saint-Émilion

Description: Superrich and packed with Merlot, this is a densely powerful wine. Its intensity is just lightened by acidity, but tannins and the rich structure dominate and are likely to keep this wine concentrated as it matures. Drink from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Haut Veyrac 2018  Saint-Émilion

Description: Black fruits and structured tannins are happily balanced by this wine's freshness. The Merlot gives a huge feel to the wine, not beating about the bush in its density and concentration. At the end, though, there is fruitiness and the promise of freshness as the wine matures. Drink from 2027.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Lafleur-Gazin 2018  Pomerol

Description: In this wine, black fruits and tannins give both a dry core and a rich texture that is already beautifully integrated with the fruit. Fresh acidity adds to the wine's attractiveness and aging potential. Drink from 2026.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Marquis de Terme 2018  Margaux

Description: This is a classic, well-structured wine. Firm tannins currently mask ripe black-currant fruit and acidity that will shortly offer succulent richness. The wine will age well. Drink from 2026.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Dassault 2018  Saint-Émilion

Description: Old vines in a 21-acre vineyard have produced this rich, dense wine. The wine has power and concentration, black-plum fruits and licorice flavors given extra power by the partial wood aging. The wine will age and should be ready from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de Chambrun 2018  Lalande de Pomerol

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Seven Hills and Ferguson vineyards make up equal parts of this wine, which is also split evenly across the two varieties. Chocolate, cherry and cedar aromas are followed by somewhat tightly wound fruit flavors, with a cranberry finish. It brings a lot of acidity and tannin structure and will have a long life ahead of it. Best after 2025.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: L'Ecole No. 41 2018 Estate Grown Cabernet Franc-Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Description: This is an estate-grown blend led by Cabernet Sauvignon that was given 23 months in French oak, 80% of it new. Thick and powerfully muscular, it offers hearty, full-bodied layers of leather, gun smoke and black currant, with well-integrated tannin and oak. It is both complex and immensely appealing.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Merryvale 2017 Profile Red (Napa Valley)

Description: This textured, fruity wine is given a firm edge by the tannins. The structure provides an important element in the wine's potential, balancing attractive black-currant flavors with a dry core. The wine should age, so drink from 2025.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Citran 2018  Haut-Médoc

Description: This is a relatively soft wine, its tannins already embracing the black-currant fruits. The structure is there, smoothly textured and ripe with fruitiness as well as good acidity. This wine is likely to develop relatively quickly, so drink from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Grand-Puy-Lacoste 2018  Pauillac

Description: The second wine of Château Olivier, this is properly advanced, with ripe berry fruits and soft tannins. It is almost ready now, juicy acidity adding freshness to the rich, dense fruitiness. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Olivier 2018 Le Dauphin d'Olivier  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: On the plain of Saint-Emilion, this vineyard has produced a richly dense wine that also shows restraint and elegant tannins. The dominance of Merlot gives the bold black fruits and acidity. Wood aging adds spice and smoothness to the texture. This wine will be ready from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Palais Cardinal 2018  Saint-Émilion

Description: Under the same ownership as Château Montrose, this estate is performing right up to its potential. With its rich tannins, dark-chocolate flavors and smoky wood aging character, the wine is coming together well. It should be ready from 2026.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Tronquoy-Lalande 2018  Saint-Estèphe

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dark berry, cocoa, violet and mahogany aromas swirl together on the nose of this blend of 82% Cabernet Franc and 18% Cabernet Sauvignon. Dry tannins provide ample support to the boysenberry and blackberry fruits on the palate, which are lifted by peppery spices and finish on a pecan-vanilla tone.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Asuncion Ridge 2017 Olivia Red (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Cabernet Sauvignon makes up 48% of this wine, with Merlot another 40% and the rest Cabernet Franc. Coming from top sites Dionysus, Bacchus, Red Willow, Klipsun and Boushey, it's all about sophistication, with its aromas and flavors of cherry, dried herbs, plum, leaf and graphite. The balance of the restrained but action-packed fruit flavors is exquisite. The finish sticks around.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Avennia 2018 Gravura Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: The two Milhade siblings have produced a rich, many-layered wine. With dense tannins balanced by equally intense fruit, this Merlot-based wine is concentrated. Black fruits, acidity and layers of tannins need time to come together. Drink from 2025.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Boutisse 2018  Saint-Émilion

Description: Big tannins and rich, succulent black fruits give a wine that is rich, solid and immensely concentrated. It is a blockbuster wine, dense and full of the ripest black fruits and promising a long aging. Drink from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Clos de Boüard 2018  Montagne-Saint-Émilion

Description: Powerfully structured, this is a big wine. Black fruits, ripe tannins and concentration are not shy in their richness. Juicy blackberry flavors are just beginning to develop and integrate with the structure. Drink from 2026.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Dauzac 2018  Margaux

Description: This classically luscious wine is full of ripe Merlot, with swathes of blackberry fruits. A solid structure behind this exuberant fruitiness suggests the wine has a rich, full future. The wine will age over the medium term. Drink from 2025.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Larmande 2018  Saint-Émilion

Description: Rich in both structure and fruit, this wine has ripe tannins and a full, generous texture that is given shape by full-bodied, black-fruit flavors. From the northern part of Pauillac, the wine is good for medium-term aging. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Pibran 2018  Pauillac

Description: This firm wine shows layers of tannins as well as the warm, rich black fruits typical of the vintage. Black-currant flavors along with the tannins give a dense wine with aging potential. Drink from 2026.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Saint-Pierre 2018  Saint-Julien

Description: Big, bold and fruity, this Merlot-dominated second wine of La Conseillante is richly structured and full of spice. Succulent black fruits dominate a concentrated wine that will age well over the medium term. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château La Conseillante 2018 Duo de Conseillante  (Pomerol)

Description: This textured wine is full of dusty tannins, ripe black fruits and a sense of forward richness. Well balanced and fruity, with an open structure, this juicy wine will be ready from 2026.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Monbrison 2018  Margaux

Description: Rich in supple Merlot, this wine shows full, ripe black fruits and plenty of solid tannins to balance. Power comes from the concentrated black-plum flavors and rich structure that have come together well. Drink from 2025.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Beauregard 2018  Pomerol

Appellation: Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: This wine has dense tannins that partner the ripe black fruits. With its full-bodied dark-plum flavors and texture that is smoothing out, the wine has weight, richness and a good future. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Bourdieu 2018 No. 1  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

Description: One of many fine estates in Moulis that include Poujeaux in their names, this wine is rich. However, it also has a stylish line of ripe tannins and black-currant fruits. The wine is set for further aging, so drink from 2025.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Branas Grand Poujeaux 2018 Grand Poujeaux  (Moulis-en-Médoc)

Appellation: Francs Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: The small appellation of Francs Côtes de Bordeaux, situated north of Castillon, can produce some impressive wines, such as this. With dark tannins and concentrated fruit, the wine, from vines planted in a former cherry orchard, is set to age. It should be ready from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de Francs 2018 Les Cerisiers  (Francs Côtes de Bordeaux)

Appellation: Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: A rich, opulent wine, this is full of dark tannins and powerful fruit. It's a big wine, with licorice and dense wood flavors that give a smoky character and reflect some serious extraction. The wine needs to smooth out to showcase its concentrated richness. Drink from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Bourdieu 2018 Absolu  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

Description: This wine is balanced, ripe and generously structured. While the wine has plenty of tannins, it also offers immediately delicious richness and black-fruit flavors. It will age well; drink from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Croix de Reverdi 2018  Haut-Médoc

Description: With 90% Merlot, this wine has density and ripe, jammy fruits. Dark chocolate and firm tannins contrast with the fruitiness, giving the structure for this solid wine to age. Drink from 2026.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Franc Mayne 2018  Saint-Émilion

Description: The latest release from this estate, in existence since the 16th century, is densely structured and packed with black-plum flavors. It is still young, vibrant with berry fruits and tannins. Give this rich wine time to smooth out and drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Jean Voisin 2018  Saint-Émilion

Description: With its ripe maturity, this wine is ready to drink. The black-currant fruits and acidity are still very present but have added spice and ripe perfumes.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Rouselle 2016 Cuvée Prestige  (Côtes de Bourg)

Description: This estate, situated just on the edge of the city of Saint-Emilion, has produced a big, juicy wine. Soft tannins and superripe black fruits suggest it will develop well over the medium term. This is a rich wine, ready to drink from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Villemaurine 2018  Saint-Émilion

Description: This generously mature wine brings plenty of juicy acidity to the tannic edge and the secondary flavors. The wine has a fair amount of weight, the tannins holding everything together. It is smoky as well as fresh on the aftertaste. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Haut Veyrac 2015  Saint-Émilion

Description: This estate, situated just on the edge of the city of Saint-Emilion, has produced a big, juicy wine. Soft tannins and superripe black fruits suggest it will develop well over the medium term. This is a rich wine, ready to drink from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Villemaurine 2018  Saint-Émilion

Description: Obvious wood aging gives this wine a smoky character. At the same time, black-currant fruits are developing and promising a richly textured wine in the future. The wine, under the same winemaking team as Château Smith Haut Lafitte, is likely to be ready from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château le Thil 2018 Comte Clary  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: Ripe and fruity with tannins that have already begun to soften, this is a full, juicy wine. Black-currant fruits show a rich, jammy character from the Merlot in the blend. Tannins come through, but gently, suggesting this wine will age relatively quickly. Drink from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Rahoul 2018  Graves

Description: This wine with dense Merlot jamminess and tannins is massive and rich. There is no shyness in this wine, which has impressive, up-front black fruits that are ready to develop. Drink from 2026.                      Roger Voss
Name: Clos Vieux Taillefer 2018  Pomerol

Description: A half-and-half blend of Merlot and Cabernet Franc, this wine is ripe and structured. Black-plum and berry flavors are balanced by the solid structure and juicy acidity that shoots through the wine. With aging potential, the wine will be ready from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de Gachet 2018  Lalande de Pomerol

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Merlot (44%) and Cabernet Franc (37%) are at the heart of this wine, supported by Malbec (17%) and Petit Verdot. It's a blend of top sites Lawrence, Stillwater Creek, Dineen, Kiona, Dionysus and others, with aromas bringing equal parts dried and fresh herbs, chocolate, roasted coffee bean and red and black cherry. There's a lovely balance to the somewhat pulled back flavors along with the pleasing acidic brightness of the vintage.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Category 5 2017 Framework Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: In this wine, dense black fruits laced with dark chocolate and licorice flavors have a powerful, solid character. The wine has a massive feel, pushing richness and demanding aging. Drink the wine from 2026.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Bourgneuf 2018  Pomerol

Description: This teeth-staining Bordeaux blend is currently in its infancy. With time in a decanter it reveals aromas of plush, brambly berries, baking spice, dried herbs, tomato leaf and a cherry cola oak note. The palate is muscular but not without finesse. Amid the big, granular tannins is a lovely line of fresh fruit. Drink 2025–2040.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Mission Estate 2018 Jewelstone Antoine Grimblett Gravels Red (Hawke's Bay)

Description: With just a touch of smoky Cabernet Franc, this wine is packed with ripe berry fruits and jammy tannins that burst with energy. The structure is coming together with the rich fruitiness to produce a wine that will age further. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château La Bastienne 2018  Montagne-Saint-Émilion

Description: Perfumed with a floral character, this is already a balanced wine. Tannins and fruit harmonize with a vanilla edge from the wood aging. This wine should be ready from 2025.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Maucaillou 2018  Moulis-en-Médoc

Description: The bold, ripe fruits of this blackberry-flavored wine are mixed generously with tannins. It is structured, still firm but with good potential. The 44-acre vineyard, dominated by Merlot, gives a wine that should be ready from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Moncets 2018  Lalande de Pomerol

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dried berry and fresh flower aromas play with leather, tangy black plum and pencil shavings on the nose of this bottling. The palate tightens around savory flavors of seared beef, charred wood and crushed lava rocks, with blackberry and black-plum elements in the midpalate.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Black Ridge 2017 San Andreas Red (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Description: With a core of structured tannins, this wine has a textured character. Blackberry fruits show through this dry core to give the wine balanced potential. It will be ready from 2025.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Cap de Mourlin 2018  Saint-Émilion

Appellation: Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: With its 70% Merlot, this wine shows black fruits that are still vibrant and bursting with brightness. There are also hints of the wine's maturity to come, the softening of the freshness. It should be ready from 2022. Organic.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de Lafaurie-Monbadon 2016  Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux

Description: Sticky tannins wrap around a core of leather, mocha and toasted oak in this blend of 60% Cabernet Sauvignon, 22% Malbec and 6% each of Petit Verdot, Cabernet Franc and Merlot. Brooding notes of blackberry and plum add to the intense mix.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Louis M. Martini 2017 Meritage (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Blackberry bush, plum and black cherry aromas sit atop notes of cedar, dark roasted coffee bean and fresh herbs on this still tightly wound offering. The palate is flavorful but remains light on its feet, with lightly grainy tannins. Give it a short decant.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Barons 2017 Petit Barone Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This Médoc estate has the same winemaking team as Château Cos d'Estournel in Saint-Estèphe. This wine is sumptuously rich, with cushioned tannins and layers of black fruits. This ripe wine will age quickly and will be ready from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Goulée by Cos d'Estournel 2018  Médoc

Description: This ripe wine comes from an estate in the Entre-deux-Mers. With generous tannins and dense black fruits, it is very much a product of the vintage. Succulent berry flavors are right up front, so let them calm down and drink the wine from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Senailhac 2018  Bordeaux Supérieur

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Blackberry bush, plum and black cherry aromas sit atop notes of cedar, dark roasted coffee bean and fresh herbs on this still tightly wound offering. The palate is flavorful but remains light on its feet, with lightly grainy tannins. Give it a short decant.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Barons 2017 Petit Barone Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This dense, Merlot-dominated wine is powerful, with some heavy extraction bitterness. While that will soften to bring forward the black fruits, the wine has a heavy feel, showing plenty of bold tannins and structure. Drink, when it all calms down, from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château du Paradis 2018  Saint-Émilion

Description: Sticky tannins wrap around a core of leather, mocha and toasted oak in this blend of 60% Cabernet Sauvignon, 22% Malbec and 6% each of Petit Verdot, Cabernet Franc and Merlot. Brooding notes of blackberry and plum add to the intense mix.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Louis M. Martini 2017 Meritage (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: The most recent purchase of the Dulon family, this estate on the slopes near the city of Cadillac has produced a wine with swathes of juicy fruits, rich tannins and a perfumed character. It will develop well and be ready to drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château du Vallier 2019  Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux

Description: This wine is definitely mature and beginning to dry out. The tannins are present but the fruit is fading. For now, it is drinkable as an older wine. Secondary flavors and spice still there. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Haut-Goujon 2014  Montagne-Saint-Émilion
