Description: A small portion of the Château Simard vineyard is treated separately, giving this wine with elegant richness and a core of solid tannins. The ripeness and generous acidity promise aging. This wine should be drunk from 2025.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Haut-Simard 2018  Saint-Émilion

Description: This 60-acre vineyard has produced a well-textured, ripe and smooth wine. With lush black fruits enlivened by acidity, the wine shows a core of dusty dryness that supports the rich fruitiness. Drink the wine from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Haut-Surget 2018  Lalande de Pomerol

Description: Soft, fruity and already delicious, this wine is open and only lightly structured. An attractive wine with black-currant flavors, it's fresh with balanced acidity. Drink from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Balestard la Tonnelle 2018  Saint-Émilion

Description: Made with 85% Merlot, this wine is richly textured, full of jammy black fruits with good structure and balancing acidity. It is coming together with its fresh edge to be drinkable from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Lyonnat 2018  Lussac Saint-Émilion

Description: This perennially satisfying and value-minded red blends 69% Cabernet Sauvignon, 13% Merlot, 9% Malbec and smaller amounts of Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. Juicy in red currant, cassis and vanilla, it has a ripe softness and enduring richness.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Girard 2018 Artistry Red (Napa Valley)

Description: A soft, ripe and fruity wine, this has attractive blackberry fruits and gentle tannins. A core of dryness gives the wine some aging potential. It will be an enjoyable, friendly wine from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Croizet-Bages 2018  Pauillac

Description: Produced by the family that owns celebrated Saint-Emilion estate Château Angélus, this wine is concentrated and rich. It presents a panoply of young, ripe berry flavors and juicy acidity, backed with solid tannins. Drink this wine from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Clos de Boüard 2018 Dame de Boüard  (Montagne-Saint-Émilion)

Appellation: Francs Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: Spicy and smoky, this firmly structured wine has rich tannins as well as black fruits, shot through with licorice and acidity. Ripe and well textured, the wine will be ready from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Haut Rozier 2018  Francs Côtes de Bordeaux

Description: This ripe blend with equal proportions of Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot is rich but stylishly structured. Black-currant fruits are still a strong element in this balanced wine that still could age. Drink now, but it's better wait until 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château la Fleur des Graves 2016  Graves de Vayres

Description: This is a ripe blend dominated by Merlot, giving the softness and richness of the black-fruit flavors. The dense texture will age over the medium term. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Palais Cardinal 2018 La Réserve  (Saint-Émilion)

Description: One of the two second wines from the estate, this offers grapes selected from a single parcel. Properly for a second wine, this is richly textured bottling is already developing well. As it ages, background tannins will smooth out and bring out the rich Merlot and Cabernet Franc flavors. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Designation: Le Palatin de Château Palais Cardinal
Name: Château Palais Cardinal 2018 Le Palatin de Château Palais Cardinal  (Saint-Émilion)

Description: This is a mature, rich wine. Secondary flavors of spice, fruit cake, and ripe tannins dominate, the fruit now fully integrated. Density and structure makes the wine a rich food accompaniment. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Rouselle 2015 Not 4 U  (Côtes de Bourg)

Description: A rich, full-bodied and dense wine, this is packed with firm tannins, up-front black fruits and powerful structure. This is not a shy wine, showing off its richness and likely to age well. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Vieux Chaigneau 2018  Lalande de Pomerol

Description: The second wine from this estate is ripe, rich with elegance and freshness as well as delicious blackberry fruits. Made by the winemaking team of Domaine de Chevalier, this wine has good depth of flavor and final freshness. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de la Solitude 2018 Chapelle de la Solitude  (Graves)

Appellation: Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: This three-century-old estate on the slope north of the Garonne river has produced a ripe, smoky wine that is now mature. With a preponderance of Merlot in the blend, it has a jammy, rich character that is just ready to drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Léon 2016  Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux

Description: Fruity with red berries and ripe tannins, this vanilla-touched wine shows both its wood aging and structure. It is a full-bodied, condensed wine that will age well. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Bois de Rolland 2019 Vieilles Vignes  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

Appellation: Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: This wine is dominated by rich, generous black fruits from Merlot, giving it a warm feel that is balanced by acidity. A bite of pepper indicates the high alcohol ,which is a shame for this otherwise maturing wine. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Bourdieu 2018  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Muddled black-cherry aromas are very rich on the nose of this blend of 70% Merlot, 25% Cabernet Sauvignon and 5% Syrah, which also shows caramel, Bourbon and prune elements. Firm tannins frame the butterscotch and baked cherry flavors, which lead into a dessert-like finish of vanilla pudding.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Lightpost 2018 Rion Reserve Red (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Description: Approaching maturity, this ripe wine is on the cusp of secondary flavors. The acidity and black fruits are still there, a reminder of the wine's ripeness and balance. Drink this wine soon, from late 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Haut-Goujon 2016  Lalande de Pomerol

Description: This ripe, full-fruited wine has great blackberry flavors. Structure and tannins give the wine a warm, open character leaving the fruitiness to shine. Drink from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Simard 2018  Saint-Émilion

Description: This rich wine is full of ripe tannins and generous black fruits. With this structure and fruitiness, it will develop well and deliciously over the medium term. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Grand Jean 2019  Bordeaux Supérieur

Description: From one of the villages north of Saint-Emilion, this is a ripe Merlot. Packed with ripe blackberry fruits and with soft tannins even after only a year, the wine is gently textured. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Bonnin Pichon 2019 Grande Réserve  (Lussac Saint-Émilion)

Description: Spicy and fruity, this fresh wine is well structured. Wood and black fruits come together easily to give richness, texture and a final burst of acidity. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château L'Oiseau 2019 Vieilles Vignes  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

Description: Full of dense, juicy Merlot, this ripe and soft wine is packed with fruitiness. Tannins show under the fruit, a layer of firmness that gives the structure the wine will need to age. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Trianon 2018  Saint-Émilion

Description: This bold, dense and tightly wound wine wraps black-cherry, dark-chocolate and blackberry flavors in firm tannins that will need time to soften for best drinking. Its attractive concentration of flavors should open up by 2024 and beyond.                      Jim Gordon
Name: LangeTwins 2017 Midnight Reserve Red (Lodi)

Description: This is a massive, mouthcoating, teeth-staining wine that's set up for the long haul. Ripe blackberry fruit dominates the palate, backed by softer notes of florals, spice and quite a bit of vanillin oak. The palate is full throttle with plush, silky fruit and drying, vise-like tannins that feel more oak-derived than fruit.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Elephant Hill 2018 Hieronymous Red (Hawke's Bay)

Appellation: Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: While this wine has plenty of tannins, it is moving quickly to maturity. A vanilla touch underlines the structure and black fruits. The wine is almost there. Wait until 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château du Cavalier 2018 Cuvée Prestige  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

Description: Lightly smoky and rich in black fruits, this is a fragrant wine. Merlot ripeness is poised with acidity, giving freshness to the peppery aftertaste. Drink the wine from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Jean Voisin 2018 L'Esprit de Jean Voisin  (Saint-Émilion)

Description: This is a ripe, generous wine, with friendly mint perfumes and black-plum flavors. The wine's structure is fully embedded in the rich texture. Drink from late 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château la Rose des Tuileries 2018  Lalande de Pomerol

Description: From a small estate in the heart of the Entre-deux-Mers, this wine has a rich structure, offering spice, succulent black-currant fruits and freshness at the end. This wood-aged wine will be ready from late 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château l'Isle Fort 2018  Bordeaux Supérieur

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of raspberry jam and whiffs of tire rubber are followed by plump fruit flavors backed by lightly grainy tannins. There's a lot to like, particularly as the reduction settles.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Claar 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: The black-fruit flavors and tannic texture of this wine are darkly powerful. With the big tannins and developing fruitiness, the wine should age well. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Croix Mouton 2019 Réserve  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

Description: With a swath of Cabernet Franc, this rich wine from the plain of Saint-Emilion is perfumed with ripe red fruits as well as generous tannins. Likely to age quickly, the wine should be ready from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine des Gourdins 2018  Saint-Émilion

Description: This blend holds a substantial proportion of Malbec, indicating the grape's increasing importance in parts of Bordeaux. Here it gives a wine that has now softened and smoothed its structure. Blackberry flavors and attractive acidity predominate, with a juicy aftertaste. Drink now. Organic.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Gory 2018  Bordeaux

Description: A high proportion of Sémillon in the blend with Sauvignon Blanc gives this wine a smooth texture allied to hints of yellow-fruit flavors. With its mineral edge, the wine could certainly age. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Grand Jean 2020  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This is a rarity, a wine made mainly with Malbec in Lalande de Pomerol. The wine has maturity, with its tannins smoothed and given juicy richness. With the secondary spicy flavors showing alongside the acidity, the wine is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Haut-Goujon 2012 Cuvée Malbec  (Lalande de Pomerol)

Description: Warm, rich and stylish, this wine has ripe tannins and generous blackberry fruits. With its dense structure and powerful fruitiness, the wine is not shy. It also needs plenty of time, so wait to drink until 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Rouselle 2018  Côtes de Bourg

Description: This smoky, wood-aged wine shows plenty of concentration. It is to be hoped that the wood flavors will integrate and give the ripe black-currant fruit a chance to shine. Tannins and acidity promise well, so wait to drink until 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Sainte-Marie 2018 Vieilles Vignes Source de Passion  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

Description: A blend of Merlot with just a touch of Cabernet Sauvignon, this balanced wine is young and spicy, with red-fruit flavors. It is still fresh and shows a tannic structure. It won't take long to be ready. Wait until 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Jalousie Beaulieu 2019  Bordeaux Supérieur

Description: This blends 37% Cabernet Sauvignon, 32% Merlot, 17% Malbec and 14% Cabernet Franc. Flavors of milk chocolate, dusty leather and blueberry highlight a core of soft, supple tannin and integrated oak, finishing in full-bodied richness.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Benziger 2017 Oonapais Red (Sonoma Valley)

Description: This blends together 55% Cabernet Sauvignon, 20% Cabernet Franc, 20% Merlot and 5% Petit Verdot and the sum is thick and meaty on the palate. Boldly ripe and chewy in tannin, the wine lingers in herbal earthiness.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Ninety+ 2018 Mountain Cuvée Lot 192 Red (Napa Valley)

Description: This mature wine is beginning to dry out. Tannins are present but maybe the fruit is fading. It is drinkable as an older wine, the secondary flavors and spice still there. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Haut-Goujon 2014  Lalande de Pomerol

Appellation: Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: This wine emphasizes fruitiness, with good balance between blackberry flavors and a structure that is becoming fully integrated. It will be ready from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château la Motte 2019  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

Description: With its balance between secondary flavors and a core of dusty tannins, this mature wine is generously ripe. A bite of licorice and touch of spice add to the complexity of this wine that is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château la Grenière 2015  Lussac Saint-Émilion

Description: This ripe, balanced wine has a good mix of black-currant fruits and light tannins. The structure and juicy acidity mean the wine is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château la Freynelle 2018 Merlot-Cabernet Sauvignon  (Bordeaux)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Attractive leather and baking-spice aromas lead to tangy red cherry and red plum in this fruity but mature-tasting wine.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Crystal Basin Cellars 2017 Triumphant Grand Reserve Red (El Dorado)

Description: Black fruits dominate this still-structured wine. With its acidity, perfumed black-currant fruits and juicy freshness, the wine is a work in progress. Give it until 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château du Mignon 2018  Saint-Émilion

Description: The dark density indicates this wine's richness. There is plenty of fruit here, but there is also plenty of extracted wood aging that leaves a bitter taste. While the wine will open up somewhat, it will likely always suffer from structure and dryness.                      Roger Voss
Name: Vieux Château Palon 2018 Palon  (Montagne-Saint-Émilion)

Description: A smoky, licorice-flavored wine, this is dense and rich. Pepper and wood flavors reflect the high alcohol that gives the wine a burnt character. While the Merlot fruit will develop, this wine will remain too strong.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Leroy-Beauval 2018  Bordeaux Supérieur

Description: Young and fruity, this is a simple, black-currant-flavored wine. Light tannins and bright fruitiness give a wine that is likely to be ready quickly. Drink from late 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Cazette 2019  Bordeaux

Description: A wine that celebrates Cabernet Franc, this comes from a parcel on the lower slope of Saint-Émilion. Its perfumed richness is profound and dense in structured black fruits. Old vines give concentration and add to the great power behind it all. This is a wine to age; drink from 2026.                      Roger Voss
Name: Le Dôme 2018  Saint-Émilion

Description: With the 65% Cabernet Sauvignon in the blend, this wine shows its pedigree, richness and potential. Tannins are almost velvet in their texture while packing a fine punch and conveying plenty of longevity. The ripeness of the vintage balances with the structure. Drink the wine from 2027.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de Chevalier 2018  Pessac-Léognan

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Clean lines of blackberry jam, charred toast and crushed slate make for a focused nose in this reserve blend of 86% Cabernet Sauvignon, 6% Merlot, 4% Cabernet Franc, 3% Malbec and 1% Petit Verdot. It is very dense and thick on the palate, where mocha, caramel, loamy earth and dark berry flavors align into an lusciously rich yet elegantly dry experience.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Justin 2016 Isosceles Reserve Red (Paso Robles)

Description: This wine comes from a prized vineyard on the slopes of Saint-Émilion. It is beautifully proportioned, rich in tannins and lush with black fruits. More importantly it is well shaped, with the richness and power masked by finesse. Drink this wine from 2026.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Vieux Mazerat 2018  Saint-Émilion

Description: This structured, dense wine is packed with as much tannins as fruit at this stage. Balance is coming and this ripe wine, with its solid, dark texture and black-plum fruits, holds good promise. Drink from 2025.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Carbonnieux 2018  Pessac-Léognan

Description: This wine displays the textured, tight mineral character for which it has become known. It comes from a small parcel on the plateau of Saint-Émilion close to the village. The wine combines powerful tannins and solid black fruits. Drink from 2026.                      Roger Voss
Name: Les Astéries 2018  Saint-Émilion

Description: There's a lovely integration of purple flowers, fresh blackberry and black plum on the nose of this blend of 39% Petit Verdot, 23% Cabernet Sauvignon, 22% Merlot and 16% Cabernet Franc. A touch of oaky wood spice shows on the palate, where just-right tannins frame rich fruit flavors that are lifted by star anise and licorice spices.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Paradise Springs 2018 The Roshi Red (California)

Description: This is one of the many wines associated with the Figeac sector of Saint-Émilion. It has the unusual addition for the area of Petit Verdot, which darkens the color and enhances tannins. It is a rich, full wine, solid and serious, full of promising tannins and black fruits. The wine will age well and over a good many years. Drink from 2025.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Yon Figeac 2018  Saint-Émilion

Description: This wine comes from an estate in the western end of the Margaux appellation. The rich tannins and structure of the wine show its aging potential. It is complex and structured, black fruits working with the well-judged tannins and dense texture. Drink this wine from 2026.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château d'Arsac 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Margaux)

Description: This wine offers great fruits and sophisticated wood-aging and spice flavors. The wine has weight, with rich berry flavors sustained by the dry core of tannins. It also has perfumed fruits, hints of mint from the new wood and a good future. Drink this wine from 2025.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château la Cabanne 2018  Pomerol

Description: A richly structured wine bursting with black fruits, this is rich in tannins and wood-aging flavors. This latest release from the estate in western Margaux is still very young but has great promise. The dominance of Cabernet Sauvignon gives the black-currant fruit and the tannins for aging. Drink this wine from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Mongravey 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Margaux)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Concentrated black-cherry-cordial aromas meet with toasty mahogany, soy and dried mushroom aromas on the intense nose of this blend of 42% Cabernet Sauvignon, 28% Merlot, 20% Petit Verdot and 10% Cabernet Franc. There's a firm density to the palate, where suave tannins wrap up cocoa, black-plum and purple-flower flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Rangeland 2016 The Watershed Red (Adelaida District)

Description: A wine that will take time to balance out, this has dense, dark and dry tannins at this stage. These underline the richness of the black fruits and acidity, giving a wine that will need to age to lose its firm edge. Drink from 2025.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de Fieuzal 2018  Pessac-Léognan

Description: This well-run estate shows its pedigree in this latest release. The firm tannins of the appellation are balanced by powerful black fruits and smoky, wood-aging flavors. The 63% Cabernet Sauvignon is the key to the wine's structure and aging potential. Drink from 2025.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Le Boscq 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Saint-Estèphe)

Description: A small parcel close to the city of Saint-Émilion produces this luscious wine. Black fruits mask the serious tannins and solid base of a wine that will certainly age. It is a full, powerful wine that will be ready to drink from 2025.                      Roger Voss
Name: Le Carré 2018  Saint-Émilion

Description: The Cuvelier family of Léoville-Poyferré in Saint-Julien have given us a strongly textured and rich wine from this property in Saint-Estèphe. Its power and density will allow it to age well. Drink this wine from 2025.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Le Crock 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Saint-Estèphe)

Description: Considerable renovation work is beginning to pay off in the quality of this latest vintage from this estate. The wine has depth, concentration, dark-chocolate flavors, rich tannins and equally rich blackberry fruits. With its high percentage of Cabernet Sauvignon,the wine is set for aging and will not be ready before 2025.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Lilian Ladouys 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Saint-Estèphe)

Description: This wine comes from one of several estates owned by the Lurton family in Pessac-Léognan. Rich in tannins as well as black fruits, this release is dense and complex, powered by its structure as much as by the fruit. It is a wine with potential, so wait to drink until 2026.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Couhins-Lurton 2018  Pessac-Léognan

Description: The Decoster family, formerly producers of porcelain in Limoges, have given this estate considerable luster. This latest release shows a solid character, powered by dark tannins, hints of licorice and rich fruit. Cabernet Franc aromas shine through the jammy Merlot. Drink from 2025.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Fleur Cardinale 2018  Saint-Émilion

Description: This wine, produced by the winemaking team of Domaine de Chevalier, is dense with solid tannins and black fruits. Everything is bursting with energy, still very young. But the wine has potential, the succulent black-currant flavors showing the way forward. Drink from 2025.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Lespault-Martillac 2018  Pessac-Léognan

Description: A rich, generous wine, this has dense black fruits and ripe tannins. Solid structure marks the wine out as ageworthy. Wait for this blend of 60% Cabernet Sauvignon and 40% Merlot to come together. Drink from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Sérilhan 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Saint-Estèphe)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Boysenberry and blueberry aromas are pure and ripe, a positive sign given that the 2016 vintage was marred by El Niño rains. An extracted palate delivers chewy tannins but also bright acidity, meaning this blend of Malbec, Cabernet Franc and Cabernet Sauvignon is in great shape. Blackberry, cassis, chocolate and baking spice flavors finish with commendable integration. Drink through 2025.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodega Norton 2016 Gernot Langes Red (Luján de Cuyo)

Description: The 90% Merlot in this wine defines its richness and dark power. Wood aging gives spice and a smoky character that will stay in this ripe, full-bodied wine as it ages. It will develop well, the tannins ready to soften and the fruit powerful and dense. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Altimar 2018 Solemnis  (Lalande de Pomerol)

Description: This is a small, 10-acre estate at the northern limit of Margaux. Perfumed and showing new-wood-aging flavors, this wine is well balanced with blackberry fruits. The wine's elegance is assured as is its aging potential. Drink from 2025.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Bellevue de Tayac 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Margaux)

Description: Owned by the Barbarian family, this 64-acre estate has produced a concentrated wine. Bold tannins mingle with perfumed blackberry fruits, promising good aging. Drink this concentrated wine from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Biston-Brillette 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Moulis-en-Médoc)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a new offering from this long-time winery, a blend of 60% Merlot, 21% Cabernet Sauvignon and 19% Cabernet Franc. The aromas take some time to get going, with notes of cocoa powder, barrel spice, dark chocolate, cherry and whiffs of green pepper. Ripe black currant and raspberry flavors follow, bringing layering and seamlessness. It sticks around for a long time on the raspberry- and cocoa-filled finish. It is absolutely delicious.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Matthews 2018 Cuvée Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Waxy plum and dark cherry flavors combine with savory accents of tobacco, dried herb and coffee in this substantial blend. A soft midpalate reveals integrated, toasted oak and tannins, leading to a finish of enduring power.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Pursuit 2018 Campfire Red (Napa Valley)

Description: While this wine, mainly Merlot, still has its structure and dry core, it is just showing richness from the generous black fruits. The wine has power and the potential for opulence. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Chateau Grange-Neuve 2016  Pomerol

Description: This Saint-Émilion classed growth shows dense black fruits, dominated by structured and perfumed Cabernet Franc. The richness is palpable, with blackberry and dark damson-plum flavors giving acidity. Solid tannins come both from the fruit and the wood aging. The wine has a fine journey ahead of it. Drink from 2025. Organic and biodynamic.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Jean Faure 2018  Saint-Émilion

Description: A mere six acres, this property is producing some fine wines. This vintage has initial softness and elegance. Fresh black fruits partner with the underlying tannic structure that will let it age. Drink this wine from 2025.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château la Fortune 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Margaux)

Description: This is already a delicious wine. Black fruits shine through the wood and tannin structure to promise a fine future. Rich while not at all overwhelming, the wine's perfumes and black-currant flavors come from the high proportion of Cabernet Sauvignon in the blend. This is a wine to age well. Drink from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château la Tonnelle 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Haut-Médoc)

Description: Rich in black fruits, this wine shows great promise. Ripe tannins and spice are cut by juicy black-currant flavors. The 133-acre estate, west of Pauillac, has produced a wine that will age. Drink from 2025.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Reysson 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Haut-Médoc)

Description: The second wine of Carbonnieux, this has structure and a firm core of tannins. Despite the high alcohol, it is fruity with black-currant flavors and some aging potential. Drink this well-formed wine from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Carbonnieux 2018 La Croix de Carbonnieux  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: This is an impressive wine. Dominated by Cabernet Sauvignon, it is full of black-plum fruits, rich tannins and great potential. The velvet texture brings out an opulent, succulent character that will remain as the wine ages. It needs to age, so drink from 2025.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Cissac 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Haut-Médoc)

Description: This wine from Pierre and Axelle Courdurié's small Saint-Émilion estate is a powerful reminder of the richness of the vintage. Its solid tannins and concentrated black fruits are impressive, dark with a structure that needs to age. The wine will take its time, so don't drink before 2025.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Croix de Labrie 2018  Saint-Émilion

Description: This elegantly structured wine already shows good balance between its tannins and generous black-currant fruits. The structure will allow it to age, promising a civilized wine that will be ready from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château d'Agassac 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Haut-Médoc)

Description: This grand estate is located just north of the village of Cérons. Its renaissance is now complete and this latest release is well structured, rich with dense tannins and juicy with black-currant flavors. The wine will certainly age. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de Cérons 2018  Graves

Description: The estate associated with this medieval bastion of Lamarque is producing some fine wines. This latest release certainly has the density and powerful richness of the vintage. But this is balanced by the structure and tannins from the Cabernet Sauvignon in the blend. The wine should wait. It will be ready from 2025.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de Lamarque 2018  Haut-Médoc

Description: This wine is richly structured, with fine tannins from both the fruit and wood aging. The wine's power is mitigated by juicy black-currant flavors and the great ripeness. Drink this wine from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Lalaudey 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Moulis-en-Médoc)

Description: This blend of 80% Merlot and 20% Cabernet Franc brings out the huge richness of the year but tempers it with structure and ageability. The weight and concentration contrast with fresher black currants that come through at the end. Drink from 2025.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Petit Faurie de Soutard 2018  Saint-Émilion

Description: This wine is richly structured, with fine tannins from both the fruit and wood aging. The wine's power is mitigated by juicy black-currant flavors and the great ripeness. Drink this wine from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Lalaudey 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Moulis-en-Médoc)

Description: This blend of 80% Merlot and 20% Cabernet Franc brings out the huge richness of the year but tempers it with structure and ageability. The weight and concentration contrast with fresher black currants that come through at the end. Drink from 2025.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Petit Faurie de Soutard 2018  Saint-Émilion

Appellation: Santa Margarita Ranch, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Aromas of black plum, sandalwood, coffee, tea and smoked teriyaki show on the savory nose of this blend of 80% Cabernet Sauvignon, 10% Petit Verdot, 5% Malbec, 4% Cabernet Franc and 1% Merlot. The palate shows meatier tones of smoked beef, hoisin sauce and cracked pepper, with a caramelized finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Ancient Peaks 2017 Oyster Ridge Red (Santa Margarita Ranch)

Description: While wood-aging shows strongly at this stage, this wine has a fine future thanks to dense black fruits that give richness, balance and acidity. The wine will develop slowly, so wait until 2025.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Bouscaut 2018  Pessac-Léognan

Description: This wine from a large estate in the southern part of Pessac-Léognan is richly textured, packed with dense black-currant fruits. The concentration and density are enhanced by firm black tannins and succulent fruitiness. Drink this wine from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château la Garde 2016  Pessac-Léognan

Description: Situated in the southern Médoc, this estate of 84 acres has produced a perfumed and rich wine. It has sensuality to it from the ripe Cabernet Sauvignon in the blend. Wood aging gives spice and a full, generous texture. Everything is in place for a good future. Drink from 2025.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Paloumey 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Haut-Médoc)

Description: While wood-aging shows strongly at this stage, this wine has a fine future thanks to dense black fruits that give richness, balance and acidity. The wine will develop slowly, so wait until 2025.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Bouscaut 2018  Pessac-Léognan

Description: A high proportion of Merlot in this blend gives richness and fruity intensity. The wine is juicy, succulent with black-plum flavors that are full and fleshy in the mouth. Its structure promises plenty of aging, so wait to drink the wine until 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château du Taillan 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Haut-Médoc)

Description: The second wine of Domaine de Chevalier, this shows all the richness of the vintage, with weighty tannins and a generous future. Blackberry fruits and a core that promises plenty of potential as the dryness softens contribute to what will be a richly structured, complex wine. Drink from 2026.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de Chevalier 2018 L'Esprit de Chevalier  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: An estate once associated with Benedictine monks has produced this dark and concentrated wine. Big tannins promise a full, rich future that will be freshened by the black-currant fruits. The wine will need time, so wait to drink until 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Vieux Château des Combes 2018  Saint-Émilion

Description: This wine is richly endowed with dark tannins and swathes of ripe black fruits. Dry with a dense tannic character, the wine has a good future. The black fruits and rich structure promise much. Drink from 2025.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Couhins 2018  Pessac-Léognan

Description: A group of the top wine consultants in the Médoc own this estate, where most vines are on gravel mounds (mothe in the local patois means mound). This latest release balances the necessary structure and rich, black-currant fruits. With a dense texture of tannins, the wine will age. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Fleur la Mothe 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Médoc)

Description: The estate on the plateau of Saint-Estèphe is well situated to produce this rich, full-bodied wine. Broad tannins give the dry core essential for aging. They are balanced by black-currant fruits from the 50% Cabernet Sauvignon in the blend. It will age well; drink from 2025.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Laffitte Carcasset 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Saint-Estèphe)

Description: This wine comes from the portion of the Arsac estate that is not in the appellation of Margaux. Rich tannins and full-bodied ripeness indicate the finesse of the estate and the potential of the wine. The juicy aftertaste bodes equally well. Drink from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château le Monteil d'Arsac 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Haut-Médoc)

Description: A powerful and dense wine, this shows the richness and the alcohol of the year. From vines that grow just south of Bordeaux city, the wine offers great tannins, a juicy black-currant character and obvious potential. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Pont Saint-Martin 2018  Pessac-Léognan

Description: Big, ripe and packed with opulent Merlot fruit, this wine is not shy. Its full black fruits and velvet tannins are luscious and will mature relatively quickly. Drink this rich wine from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Clos Beauregard 2018  Pomerol

Description: A richly perfumed, full-bodied wine, this has dense tannins and equally dense black fruits. With a firm hold on the structure, the wine will will age well, giving concentration and powerful fruits. Drink now, but the wine will be better from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Beauséjour 2015 Old Vines  (Puisseguin Saint-Émilion)

Description: Big, bold black fruits and rich tannins give structure to this solid, dense and concentrated wine. It shows maybe a tad too much alcohol, but that will go as this Merlot and Cabernet Franc blend ages. Drink from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Cadet-Bon 2018  Saint-Émilion

Description: From one of several estates owned by the Chanfreau family in Moulis and Listrac, this is a spicy, obviously wood-aged, wine. If the wood flavors are too prominent at this stage, proper integration comes with the dense blackberry fruits and acidity. So give the wine time and drink from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Caroline 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Moulis-en-Médoc)

Appellation: Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: A perfumed, wood-aged wine, this has richness and complexity. Warm, ripe tannins show dryness at this stage but are imminently turning into a generous support for the black-plum fruits. This wine has a fine future. Wait to drink until 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de Belcier 2018 Le Pin de Belcier  (Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux)

Description: The vineyard of the ancient moated castle of La Brède, birthplace of writer Montesquieu, has produced a densely structured, dark and firm wine. It is lots of potential with ripe tannins and powerful black fruits developing in the background. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de la Brède 2018  Graves

Description: This is the latest release from this grand estate in the southern Médoc. Bold tannins go well with the richly structured blackberry fruits and spiciness. The wine, ripe with Merlot, will age well. Drink from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de Malleret 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Haut-Médoc)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Deep aromas of blackberry, cherry, baking spice and toasty wood show on the nose of this blend of 40% Cabernet Sauvignon, 20% Malbec, 16% Petit Verdot, 12% Merlot and 12% Cabernet Franc. Lush fruit flavors meet with toasty oak spice, offering a very satisfying, hearty red wine experience.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: San Simeon 2017 Stormwatch Estate Reserve Red (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Merlot comprises over three-quarters of this wine, with the rest Cabernet Sauvignon and Malbec. Appealing aromas of dried herbs, cherry and raspberry lead to a zippy currant flavor that fleshes out over time. The acidity is tart and bright, lifting it all up. Best after 2023.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Designation: La Domestique Reserve Double D Vineyard
Name: Rocky Pond 2017 La Domestique Reserve Double D Vineyard Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This is an elegant wine, structured with firm tannins and finely wrought black fruits. Hints of the wood aging will become fully integrated with the other elements over the next few months. This wine needs time, so drink from 2023. Organic.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château du Seuil 2018  Graves

Description: Produced from the youngest vines at this classed growth estate, this wine has good balance between perfumed wood aging and buoyant black fruits. The tannins and dense structure promise aging although the wine is likely to develop relatively quickly as befits a second wine. Drink from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Grand-Puy Ducasse 2018 Prélude à Grand-Puy Ducasse  (Pauillac)

Appellation: Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: A blend of Cabernet Franc and Merlot, this wine has fruitiness, richness and structure. Tannins are cushioned by generous, vibrant black-plum fruits that will bear further aging. Rich and full, the wine will best from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Mauperey 2018  Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux

Description: A 24-acre vineyard close to Saint-Estèphe has produced this rich and dense wine. Tannins give a solid base to generous black-plum and berry fruits. Initially it seems as though this wine will develop quickly, but that is deceptive. With the tannic core and firm aftertaste, the wine will take its time. Drink from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Maurac 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Haut-Médoc)

Description: With 25% Petit Verdot in the blend, this is an unusual wine but one that wears its rich, dusty tannins easily. It is full bodied, with structure and dark and concentrated blackberry fruits. Drink this wine from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Reverdi 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Listrac-Médoc)

Description: This wine is young but has great potential. The tannins shine, balanced with powerful black fruits and a solid, dense texture. The wine will age well and will be at its best from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de Chantegrive 2018  Graves

Description: Wood aging has given this rich wine a perfumed character, as well as dry tannins that will soften over the next years. This ripe and structured wine will be ready from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château des Places 2018 Agora  (Graves)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Plum, black currant and barrel spice aromas are followed by broad dark fruit and spice flavors that show plenty of concentration and intensity. It brings a real sense a depth from start to finish.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: 10,000 Hours 2018 Red (Red Mountain)

Description: Dark and rich, this is a strongly structured wine, with a majority of Cabernet Franc. Big tannins go with dark-chocolate flavors to contrast with black-plum fruits and general richness. Drink this ripe, perfumed wine from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Altimar 2018  Lalande de Pomerol

Description: Under the same management as Château Beychevelle in Saint-Julien, this estate is now showing its fine potential. The balance between Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot means vivid fruits as well as rich tannins. The wine should develop well but it will be best to wait until 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Beaumont 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Haut-Médoc)

Description: Dominated by Merlot, this wine is still full of dense tannins. But the jammy black fruits and generous texture point to a more open future. Succulent and juicy, the wine will be ready from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Haut-Maillet 2018  Pomerol

Description: Sophisticated tannins and rich wood flavors go with the generous black fruits of this Merlot-dominated wine. It is powered by dark berry flavors and the core of dryness, both of which promise good aging over the years. Drink this wine from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château la Tour de By 2018 Cuvée Héritage  (Médoc)

Description: Associated with Larose-Trintaudon, this estate has produced a dense wine. Rich tannins, spice, blackberry fruits and smoky acidity are all set for good aging. The wine's concentration is impressive and it should not be drunk before 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Larose Perganson 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Haut-Médoc)

Description: This complex wine has layers of black-currant fruits under the firm, dry texture. It shows great potential, with the Cabernet Sauvignon lending structure to the ripe Merlot. The wine should be ready from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Lestage Simon 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Haut-Médoc)

Description: A blend of 50% Cabernets, this is solid and rich in black-currant and spice flavors. It has the weight and potential to age well, showing plenty of dark tannins and acidity. Drink this wine from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Roche-Lalande 2018  Pessac-Léognan

Description: This wine comes from an estate owned by a religious order and managed by Domaine de Chevalier. Luscious black fruits are sophisticated and full. Embedded in the black fruits, the tannins are just showing their potential as the wine opens out. This will be a fine wine with time. Drink from 2025.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de la Solitude 2018  Pessac-Léognan

Description: From one of the best-performing estates in the Graves appellation, this wine has rich tannins as well as dense black-currant fruits. It is a solid, dark and likely long-lived wine. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Ferrande 2018  Graves

Description: Low-yielding parcels of vines provide the fruit for this wood-aged wine. It has weight and a serious side, emphasizing ripeness and powerful concentration. The wine's density will soften into richness and opulence. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Haut Selve 2018 Réserve  (Graves)

Description: This ripe, juicy wine comes from a vineyard planted around a medieval priory. The wine has spice, ripe tannins and attractive black-currant and red-berry fruits. The winning combination should age well, so drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Arnauld 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Haut-Médoc)

Description: This ripe wine already has an attractive balance between structure and blackberry fruits. The smoky, dry character will soften as it ages. The wine will mature well. Drink from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de l'Annonciation 2018  Saint-Émilion

Description: Low-yielding parcels of vines provide the fruit for this wood-aged wine. It has weight and a serious side, emphasizing ripeness and powerful concentration. The wine's density will soften into richness and opulence. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Haut Selve 2018 Réserve  (Graves)

Description: Dark tannins dominate this richly structured wine. Mint perfumes from the wood aging are balanced by the concentrated black-plum fruit. This is a big wine, ready to age. Drink from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château la Confession 2018  Saint-Émilion

Description: A bold, ripe and juicy wine, this is developing well. Its big tannins and satisfying blend of Merlot and Cabernet Franc show potential richness and structure. Blackberry and black-plum flavors are impressive. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château la Perrière 2018  Lussac Saint-Émilion

Description: This is the second wine of Latour-Martillac. The wine is ripe and while it does have tannins, it emphasizes the rich black fruits. A touch of smokiness from wood aging gives spice to the wine. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Latour-Martillac 2018 Lagrave-Martillac  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: Young but already elegant and complex, this wine is destined for long-term aging. Ripe blackberry fruits and serious tannins will take time to mature. Drink from 2025 when this wine will be in balance.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Paveil de Luze 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Margaux)

Description: This estate, touching Pauillac, belongs to the Bernard family, also owners of Domaine de Chevalier. Rich tannins and wood aging have given intense spice to this wine that is bold, rich and concentrated. The vivid, ripe black fruits will calm down as the wine ages further, giving a balanced, smooth blend. Drink from 2025.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Peyrabon 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Haut-Médoc)

Description: From an 18 parcel vineyard once owned by Lafite-Rothschild. Rich tannins are polished and smoothly textured, belying the firm backdrop of tannins. Fruity now, the wine is worth waiting for. Drink from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Ramafort 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Médoc)

Appellation: Côtes de Bergerac, Southwest France, France
Description: This rich, perfumed and smoky wine comes from a parcel of old Cabernet Franc. It is very young, expressing black-currant fruits and considerable acidity, both of which will soften as the wine matures. The structure is just right and the wine will be impressive. Drink from 2023. Organic.                      Roger Voss
Designation: Les Anciens Francs Parcelle No A252
Name: Château Tour des Gendres 2018 Les Anciens Francs Parcelle No A252 Red (Côtes de Bergerac)

Description: This richly structured wine with layers of black tannins and solid berry fruits shows good concentration. Spice from wood aging and perfumes from Cabernet Franc contribute to the wine's generous completeness. It has plenty of potential, so drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Ascumbas 2018 Cuvée Saint Vincent  (Saint-Émilion)

Description: This small 17-acre property has produced a sophisticated, black-fruit-flavored wine. Smooth tannins and dense black fruits offer the prospect of a rich wine that is both structured and fruity. Drink this wine from 2025.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de Côme 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Saint-Estèphe)

Description: This wine has dense tannins along with perfumed spice, rich blackberry fruits and the weight of the alcohol. At this stage, all the elements are poised to integrate, promising a wine with a rich, full and concentrated future. Drink from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château du Retout 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Haut-Médoc)

Description: This second wine of Fleur Cardinale is ripe and on the fruity side, with fine tannins that are already integrated with the structure of sweet tannins. Dominated by Merlot, it is a fruity, succulent wine that will develop quickly. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Fleur Cardinale 2018 Intuition de Fleur Cardinale  (Saint-Émilion)

Description: From one of the estates owned by the Borie family of Ducru-Beaucaillou in Saint-Julien, this wine has the same fine attention to detail, from the rich tannins to the warm black fruits. Its rich structure is equalled by the generous fruits and considerable aging potential. Drink the wine from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Fourcas-Borie 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Listrac-Médoc)

Description: Vineyards in the west of Saint-Émilion have produced this well-structured, balanced wine. Although still young, the rich tannins and blackberry flavors have great promise. It shows good equilibrium between fruit and dense structure and needs more time. Drink from 2025.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Grand Barrail Lamarzelle Figeac 2018  Saint-Émilion

Description: This is a rich, juicy and structured wine. Bold tannins combine with black-currant flavors to give a ripe wine, equally solid with fruit and tannin. It should develop well, bringing out fruit and smoothing the texture. Drink from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Chateau Grange-Neuve 2018  Pomerol

Description: This wine offers rich tannins and dense black fruits in equal proportions. The structure, with the dry core, shows great promise and the wine is definitely worth aging. Drink from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château La Cardonne 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Médoc)

Description: This 24-acre property has large plantings of old vines, dominated by the Cabernet Sauvignon that appears in this blend. That gives the wine shape and tannins, as well as rich black-currant fruits. This succulent wine is likely to age well. Drink from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Peyredon Lagravette 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Haut-Médoc)

Description: A bold, smoky and generous wine, this shows perfumed wood-aging flavors as well as ripe blackberry fruits. Dominated by Merlot, but with a good proportion of Cabernet Franc, the wine should age well. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Vieux Cardinal Lafaurie 2018  Lalande de Pomerol

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Coming from some of the oldest vines in the Pacific Northwest, this wine is 71% Cabernet Sauvignon, 20% Malbec and 9% Merlot. The aromas are pulled back, with notes of plum, dried leaves, cherry and whiffs of tar. The flavors are plump, joyful and well-balanced, with an emphasis on purity. It's a testament to old vine fruit—and all about sophistication.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: History 2017 Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This richly structured wine with layers of black tannins and solid berry fruits shows good concentration. Spice from wood aging and perfumes from Cabernet Franc contribute to the wine's generous completeness. It has plenty of potential, so drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Ascumbas 2018 Cuvée Saint Vincent  (Saint-Émilion)

Description: This small 17-acre property has produced a sophisticated, black-fruit-flavored wine. Smooth tannins and dense black fruits offer the prospect of a rich wine that is both structured and fruity. Drink this wine from 2025.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de Côme 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Saint-Estèphe)

Description: The structured Cabernet Sauvignon in this ripe wine gives attractive black-currant flavors and a core of tannins that will allow it to age. It is a great food wine: fruity, structured and sure to age well. Drink from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château la Tour de By 2018  Médoc

Description: The Anney family, owners of this estate, have been growers in the Médoc since the 17th century. This wine, with rich tannins and the typical structure of the appellation, is ripe, packed with black-plum fruits and generous Merlot richness. It is a wine to age, best left until 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Tour des Termes 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Saint-Estèphe)

Description: One of the properties of the Dubourdieu family, this estate has made a rich wine, packed with tannins as well as black fruits. It has concentration and wood-aging flavors that are still prominent, but the future looks good. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Clos Floridène 2018  Graves

Description: From a vineyard on the eastern side of Saint-Émilion, this wine offers stylish Merlot that is fresh and well balanced. The supple texture is underpinned by tannins that are now just soft enough. The wine, though, is still fresh and will age further. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Bardoulet 2016  Saint-Émilion

Description: This wine comes from specific parcels in the Château de Cérons estate. It is light, with a fresh line of black-currant fruits. Solid tannins in the background assure further aging. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Calvimont 2018  Graves

Description: This ripe, elegant wine has layers of the typical tannins of the appellation alongside well-structured, black-currant fruits. With a slight preponderance of Merlot, the blend still leaves room for the fine texture of Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Coussieu-Coutelin 2017  Saint-Estèphe

Description: The vineyard is situated just west of Château Mongravey. Firm tannins are derived both from wood and fruit, giving this wine power and potential. Black fruits are beautifully perfumed from the wood aging. This wine should develop well. Drink from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de Braude 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Haut-Médoc)

Description: The home vineyard for the Chanfreau family has produced this dense wine that shows some of the firm tannins of a Listrac. At the same time, the rich fruit typical of the vintage, from equal proportions of Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon, is prominent, giving good aging potential.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Fonréaud 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Médoc)

Description: Bold and rich, this ripe black-currant-flavored wine come from vineyards on the plain below Saint-Émilion center. With the rich Merlot dominant, the wine has density and concentration that will allow it to age. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Franc Lartigue 2018  Saint-Émilion

Description: Ripe aromas of blackberry, herbs and spices open this blend of Malbec, Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. The palate is saturated but kicking, with tannic bite. Peppery blackberry and cassis flavors are slightly stalky before dissipating on a brisk finish. Drink now.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bressia 2014 Conjuro Red (Mendoza)

Description: In this wine, rich berry flavors cover the firm structure that brings in tannins and wood-aging flavors. The black fruits are ripe, spicy and laden with jammy, succulent Merlot. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Bourseau 2018  Lalande de Pomerol

Description: Smoky and ripe, this generously textured, rich second wine has delicious black-currant fruitiness as well as layers of spice from wood aging. The wine will be ready from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Bouscaut 2018 Les Chênes de Bouscaut  (Pessac-Léognan)

Appellation: Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: A south-facing vineyard on the slope above the city of Castillon has yielded this generous, rich and juicy wine. Black fruits are already shining with ripeness, about to burst out through the tannins. The wine will be ready from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Bréhat 2018  Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux

Description: The estate lies in the village of Néac. At five years old, this wine is just beginning to show signs of maturity, with tannins that are smoothing out and blackberry fruits and generous Merlot flavors coming forward. Drink the wine from late 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Canon Chaigneau 2015  Lalande de Pomerol

Description: A structured wine, this comes from a vineyard around a 17th-century chateau. It has tannins, perfumes from the Cabernets in the blend and a rich future. Drink this powerful wine from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Cantin 2018  Saint-Émilion

Description: Under the same ownership as Château la Dominique in Saint-Émilion, this estate has produced a ripe, Merlot-dominated wine. Although the fruit is intense, this wine has poise and clarity, giving some lightness. It will be worth waiting for this wine until 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Clément-Pichon 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Haut-Médoc)

Appellation: Côtes de Bergerac, Southwest France, France
Description: Aged for over a year in new wood, this wine has a spicy, toasty character. But that plays a supporting role to the rich black-currant fruits and serious tannins from the 90% Cabernet Sauvignon in the blend. The wine is ready to age further. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Le Clos du Breil 2018 Lei Peires Red (Côtes de Bergerac)

Description: A powerful and full-bodied wine still with some signs of wood aging, this is rich with black fruits and seriously structured with tannins. Its spicy character, hints of toast and dry core all point to ageworthiness. Drink this wine from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de Passedieu 2018  Côtes de Bourg

Appellation: Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: Named after Léonard Nebout who was a founder of this estate, this generous wine was produced from old vines. It offers firm tannins along with swathes of black-currant fruits and richness. Drink from 2023. Organic.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Beynat 2018 Cuvée Léonard  (Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux)

Description: Structured with firm, dark tannins and rich with concentrated black fruits, this second wine is still coming together. The tight, spicy character will soften over the next months giving a dense, rich wine. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Couhins 2018 La Dame de Couhins  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: From an estate owned by the Chanfreau family in Listrac, this wine currently shows considerable wood-aging flavors that need to integrate. Once they have, the weight of the succulent black fruits will start to come through. The wine has potential. Drink from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Lestage 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Listrac-Médoc)

Description: Balanced between tannins and black fruits, this wine is dense and solid, showing the opulent fruit of this vintage. It does have a structure and therefore aging potential, rich in blackberry flavors and with a dry core. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Maucamps 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Haut-Médoc)

Description: A smooth and richly textured wine, this has equal proportions of Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. Dark-chocolate flavors balance ripe blackberry fruits and firm tannins to produce a wine that is sure to age. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Haut-Logat 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Haut-Médoc)

Appellation: Côtes de Bergerac, Southwest France, France
Description: This is a powerful wine, rich in tannins as well as blackberry fruits. With a good proportion of Malbec in the blend, the wine is dark in color and in tannin intensity. It needs plenty of aging and should not be drunk before 2023. Organic.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Tour des Gendres 2018 La Gloire de Mon Père Red (Côtes de Bergerac)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is 69% Cabernet Sauvignon, 20% Merlot and 11% Cabernet Franc. With fruit coming from McClellan, Pepper Bridge, Anna Marie and Eritage vineyards, the aromas bring notes of plum, blue fruit, earth, dried and fresh herbs and flowers. Soft, lighter-styled coffee, cherry and chocolate flavors follow. It's all about grace.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Saviah 2018 Une Vallée Red (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dark cassis and black-plum aromas meet with cocoa and oak on the nose of this blend of 33% Malbec, 22% Merlot, 17% Petit Verdot, 17% Cabernet Sauvignon, 6% Cabernet Franc and 5% Carignan. The oak is prominent on the sip, where mocha and more cassis flavors make for a lush and complex experience.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Écluse 2018 Ensemble Red (Paso Robles)

Description: A generous, rich and velvet-textured wine, this is full bodied and opulent. A core of tannins gives aging promise, but the blackberry fruits are cushioning and plump, imparting fruitiness. Drink from 2024. Organic.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Beauséjour 2018  Puisseguin Saint-Émilion

Description: Wood aged and with attractive blackberry fruits, this solid wine is packed with dry tannins that will soften. With its structure and concentrated fruits, the wine will age well. Drink this full-bodied wine from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Cap Léon Veyrin 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Listrac-Médoc)

Description: The wine from this large 150-acre estate is always reliable. This latest release may have considerable wood-aging flavors at this stage but it also offers delicious black-currant fruits to go with the ripe tannins. It is a wine to age, so wait until 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Castera 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Médoc)

Description: With a dominance of Merlot, this second wine of Château de Fieuzal is rich while keeping a good sense of proportion and accessibility. Soft tannins give shape and set off the blackberry fruits. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de Fieuzal 2018 L'Abeille de Fieuzal  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: This powerful, Merlot-dominated wine shows great concentration and richness. The density is enhanced by the core of dark tannins while leaving plenty of room for the blackberry and dark-plum flavors. This will be an attractive wine, but wait until 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Grivière 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Médoc)

Description: The second wine of Croix de Labrie, this offers rich black fruits and a smooth texture. Tannins have already softened into the ripe black fruits that are packed with black-plum-skin flavors, with an immediately accessible juicy fruitiness. Drink the wine from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Croix de Labrie 2018 Chapelle de Labrie  (Saint-Émilion)

Description: This powerful, Merlot-dominated wine shows great concentration and richness. The density is enhanced by the core of dark tannins while leaving plenty of room for the blackberry and dark-plum flavors. This will be an attractive wine, but wait until 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Grivière 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Médoc)

Description: From an estate owned by the Fabre family, this juicy wine offers black-currant flavors from the 58% Cabernet Sauvignon. It is ripe and attractively balanced, full of berry flavors and good acidity. The wine has the vibrancy of youth but will age well, so wait until 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Lamothe-Cissac 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Haut-Médoc)

Description: From one of the largest estates in the Médoc, this wine is packed with black-currant fruits and elegant tannins. Initially it seems light, but a core of structure and classic poise between fruit and tannin make the wine a candidate for aging. Drink from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Larose-Trintaudon 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Haut-Médoc)

Description: Succulent and juicy, this is a full, rich wine. Its tannins and black-currant fruitiness are already in harmony, giving a wine that is both delicious and structured. It should age well, so drink this full-bodied wine from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Lestruelle 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Médoc)

Description: The 24-acre estate has produced a structured wine, still showing some of its wood aging but also giving richness and density. Because of its youthful fruit and tannins, this wine is set for aging. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Fontis 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Médoc)

Description: Almost entirely Merlot, this generous wine is packed with black-plum fruits. Rich tannins, spice and touches of licorice go with the bold fruits and structure. The wine will be ready from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château la Papeterie 2018  Montagne-Saint-Émilion

Description: This structured wine is elegant in its balance between tannins and black fruits, making it a candidate for long-term aging. A smoky character from wood aging is integrating well with the structure. Drink this wine from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Ramage la Batisse 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Haut-Médoc)

Description: Half-and-half Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot, this wine from a 350-acre estate is perfumed, ripe with rich tannins. At the same time, a juicy, black-currant character gives freshness. The structure promises the aging, so drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Tour Prignac 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Médoc)

Appellation: Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: The high percentage of Cabernet Franc in this blend gives it an elegant and perfumed character. It contrasts with the more jammy Merlot to give the wine stylish richness. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de Belcier 2018 Cuvée B  (Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux)

Description: This is a moderately cool climate Bordeaux-style blend from steep, low-yielding vines that delivers the heady aromatics of blueberry and black currant compote, violet, pepper and medicinal herbs. The palate is less broad and more linear, wound in taut, chalky tannins and lifted acidity. A chiseled, muscular wine that's fresh but also seems to be showing a fair bit of bottle age.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Levantine Hill 2015 Samantha's Paddock Melange Traditionnel Red (Yarra Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Crumpled lavender and violet aromas meet with crisp black raspberry, tangy black plum and a hint of incense on the nose of this blend of 29% Cabernet Franc, 29% Cabernet Sauvignon, 28% Merlot and 14% Zinfandel. There's a lighter tone on the palate, where those tight red fruits meet with bay leaf, herbs and a bit of toast.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Écluse 2018 Intonation Winemaker Series Red (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Crumpled purple flowers, elderberry and pencil shavings make for a focused, linear nose on this blend of 72% Cabernet Sauvignon, 16% Merlot, 6% Petit Verdot and 6% Malbec. The palate is also very focused and floral, showing black plum as well as lilac, violet and lavender flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Estancia 2017 Reserve Meritage (Paso Robles)

Description: Full-bodied, ripe blackberry fruits shine strongly in this rich wine. Succulent fruitiness is allied to a core of tannins. This wine comes from a much improved and restored estate, now worth watching. Drink the wine from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Gemeillan 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Médoc)

Description: Ripe and juicy, this wine is all about generous black fruits. Its dense texture and structure from the 55% Cabernet Sauvignon in the blend shows the aging potential. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château la Croix Margautot 2018  Haut-Médoc

Description: Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon with a touch of Petit Verdot make a satisfying blend in this ripe, smoky and warmly structured wine. It still has plenty of tannin while the black fruits are pushing forward. The wine needs more time, so drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Le Bourdieu 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Médoc)

Description: From a vineyard in the northern Bordeaux region, this ripe, spicy wine is packed with dark fruits and worth aging. Rich tannins march with dark berry flavors to give a dense, full-bodied wine. Age this wine and drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Timberlay 2018  Bordeaux Supérieur

Description: From a vineyard in the northern Bordeaux region, this ripe, spicy wine is packed with dark fruits and worth aging. Rich tannins march with dark berry flavors to give a dense, full-bodied wine. Age this wine and drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Timberlay 2018  Bordeaux Supérieur

Description: This is a stylish, if also powerful, wine. Layers of black fruits and dark tannins give the wine weight. The 20% Cabernet Franc in the blend brings in its ineffable perfume and structure. Drink the wine from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Designation: L'Enclos des Domaines Edmond de Rothschild
Name: Barons Edmond Benjamin de Rothschild 2016 L'Enclos des Domaines Edmond de Rothschild  (Puisseguin Saint-Émilion)

Description: Although it is based in Lalande de Pomerol, the estate also has vines in Saint-Émilion. This wine with its elegant proportion of Cabernet Franc is structured and ageworthy. It has a poised freshness, with juicy acidity and texture from the dry core. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Altimar 2018 Puy Versannes  (Saint-Émilion)

Description: A half-and-half blend of Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon, this is a ripe, black-currant-flavored and smoothly textured wine. Light smokiness from wood aging brings complexity. Acidity comes through freshly and strongly at the end. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Amour 2018  Médoc

Description: This 21-acre, family-owned estate has produced an attractively fruity wine. The balance between tannins and vibrant black fruits promises a generous future. Black-currant flavors from the 65% Cabernet Sauvignon gives a final fresh layer on top of the tannins. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Corconnac 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Haut-Médoc)

Description: This rich wine is powered by tannins and generous blackberry fruits. It is currently dry, with a firm core. But the wine has weight and will develop well. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Crabitey 2018  Graves

Description: This dry yet ripe wine comes from one of the top estates in the Graves. Tannins confer richness and add substance to the black fruits. Drink this wine from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Vieux Château Gaubert 2018  Graves

Description: With 30% wood aging, this wine has both richness and structure. It has a tight, black plum and tannin character, with layers of wood and spice coming through the dense fruitiness. The wine has a future. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Lamartine 2018  Cahors

Description: This elegant wine is spiced with wood aging that will soften and poised with black-currant fruits. A fine layer of acidity balances the tannins and gives the wine freshness and potential. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château le Vieux Fort 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Médoc)

Description: From the southern sector of Haut-Médoc, this wine is well-structured in fine tannins and attractive black-currant fruit. The heft and spicy character from the wood promise aging. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Magnol 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Haut-Médoc)

Description: With luscious black fruits, this wine is immediately attractive. The structure also has plenty of promise. Underneath the blackberry fruitiness, a dry, solid base will allow the wine to age. Drink from 2024. Organic.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Meyre 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Haut-Médoc)

Description: Owned by the De Butler family, this estate has produced a soft, juicy and black-fruited wine. Generous tannins and crisp acidity come together with succulent fruit to give a wine that will develop quickly. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Trébiac 2018  Graves

Description: With 30% wood aging, this wine has both richness and structure. It has a tight, black plum and tannin character, with layers of wood and spice coming through the dense fruitiness. The wine has a future. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Lamartine 2018  Cahors

Description: This elegant wine is spiced with wood aging that will soften and poised with black-currant fruits. A fine layer of acidity balances the tannins and gives the wine freshness and potential. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château le Vieux Fort 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Médoc)

Description: From the southern sector of Haut-Médoc, this wine is well-structured in fine tannins and attractive black-currant fruit. The heft and spicy character from the wood promise aging. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Magnol 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Haut-Médoc)

Description: With luscious black fruits, this wine is immediately attractive. The structure also has plenty of promise. Underneath the blackberry fruitiness, a dry, solid base will allow the wine to age. Drink from 2024. Organic.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Meyre 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Haut-Médoc)

Description: Owned by the De Butler family, this estate has produced a soft, juicy and black-fruited wine. Generous tannins and crisp acidity come together with succulent fruit to give a wine that will develop quickly. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Trébiac 2018  Graves

Description: A darkly concentrated color and aromas of black fruits, road tar and lemony oak lead to a full palate with moderate acidity. Spicy, chocolaty oak notes add depth to berry flavors, while this blend of Malbec and Cabernet Sauvignon finishes level and steady.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Colección Quinquela 2018 Motivo de Puerto Single Vineyard Red (Famatina Valley)

Description: This dry yet ripe wine comes from one of the top estates in the Graves. Tannins confer richness and add substance to the black fruits. Drink this wine from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Vieux Château Gaubert 2018  Graves

Description: Black, solid and richly structured, this wine is all about its dark fruits and dry core. A suggestion of too much extraction gives a dry edge to the wine while the rich tannins of the year are still a major factor. It should soften, so it's best to wait for the rich fruits to come through from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château du Courlat 2016  Lussac Saint-Émilion

Description: Almost entirely Merlot, this smooth, ripely textured wine has generous black fruits that show well against the background of firm tannins and solid wood-aging flavors. The wine will be ready from 2025.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Belugue 2018  Fronsac

Description: Named after the royal family of Sweden, this estate is now producing wines worthy of the pedigree. This latest release is rich and balanced, offering black fruits dominated by Merlot and bold tannins. It is a powerful wine that will take time. Drink from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Bernadotte 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Haut-Médoc)

Description: Ripe and smoky, this wine is just approaching maturity. Blackberry fruits are matched by spice and hints of toastiness from wood aging. It has ripe berries, acidity and the potential for a little more aging. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Bessan Ségur 2016 Cru Bourgeois  (Médoc)

Description: This wine has the dry tannins of the vintage at this stage, which give a dense character that needs to soften and open out. As the underlying berry fruits come forward, this wine will begin to shine. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Canon Chaigneau 2016  Lalande de Pomerol

Description: Black, solid and richly structured, this wine is all about its dark fruits and dry core. A suggestion of too much extraction gives a dry edge to the wine while the rich tannins of the year are still a major factor. It should soften, so it's best to wait for the rich fruits to come through from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château du Courlat 2016  Lussac Saint-Émilion

Description: Almost entirely Merlot, this smooth, ripely textured wine has generous black fruits that show well against the background of firm tannins and solid wood-aging flavors. The wine will be ready from 2025.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Belugue 2018  Fronsac

Description: Named after the royal family of Sweden, this estate is now producing wines worthy of the pedigree. This latest release is rich and balanced, offering black fruits dominated by Merlot and bold tannins. It is a powerful wine that will take time. Drink from 2024.                      Roger Voss
