Name: Château Bernadotte 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Haut-Médoc)

Description: Ripe and smoky, this wine is just approaching maturity. Blackberry fruits are matched by spice and hints of toastiness from wood aging. It has ripe berries, acidity and the potential for a little more aging. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Bessan Ségur 2016 Cru Bourgeois  (Médoc)

Description: This wine has the dry tannins of the vintage at this stage, which give a dense character that needs to soften and open out. As the underlying berry fruits come forward, this wine will begin to shine. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Canon Chaigneau 2016  Lalande de Pomerol

Description: From a village north of Saint-Émilion, this chocolate- and black-fruit flavored wine is young, dense and firm with tannins. A succulent edge promises well for the future of this powerful blend with its 86% Merlot. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Cap d'Or 2018  Saint-Georges-Saint-Émilion

Description: This wine is immediately attractive. Wood aging gives a smoky character to the warm black fruits. Tannins give support and a dry core that will allow the wine to age. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Campillot 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Médoc)

Description: While this wine shows considerable wood-aging flavors, that is temporary. Under that toastiness lies layers of rich tannins and impressive black-currant flavors. The wine has a fine future. Drink from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Chemin-Royal 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Moulis-en-Médoc)

Description: This wine has perfumed wood flavors, hints of mint and plenty of black fruits. Rich tannins come through strongly in this full-bodied wine that offers generous fruitiness and structure. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de Castres 2018  Graves

Description: Powerful and rich, this is a densely textured, wood-aged wine. Ripe blackberry fruits are laced with perfumed crisp acidity that will support the wine as it matures. It will be a full and juicy wine from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de Chantegrive 2018 Les Oiseaux de Chantegrive L'Origine  (Graves)

Description: The top wine from this estate, this is densely textured and rich with dry tannins and juicy black-plum-skin flavors. The wine has weight, concentration and a fine future. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de la Grave 2016 Caractère  (Côtes de Bourg)

Description: Iron and rock elements complement a thick and concentrated midpalate of black currant, gunpowder and tannin in this robust, complex blend. Powerfully intense, it delivers a wealth of flavor and texture, finishing in substantial oak.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Knights Bridge 2017 Estate Red (Knights Valley)

Description: Iron and rock elements complement a thick and concentrated midpalate of black currant, gunpowder and tannin in this robust, complex blend. Powerfully intense, it delivers a wealth of flavor and texture, finishing in substantial oak.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Knights Bridge 2017 Estate Red (Knights Valley)

Description: This wine is immediately attractive. Wood aging gives a smoky character to the warm black fruits. Tannins give support and a dry core that will allow the wine to age. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Campillot 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Médoc)

Description: While this wine shows considerable wood-aging flavors, that is temporary. Under that toastiness lies layers of rich tannins and impressive black-currant flavors. The wine has a fine future. Drink from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Chemin-Royal 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Moulis-en-Médoc)

Description: This wine has perfumed wood flavors, hints of mint and plenty of black fruits. Rich tannins come through strongly in this full-bodied wine that offers generous fruitiness and structure. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de Castres 2018  Graves

Description: Powerful and rich, this is a densely textured, wood-aged wine. Ripe blackberry fruits are laced with perfumed crisp acidity that will support the wine as it matures. It will be a full and juicy wine from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de Chantegrive 2018 Les Oiseaux de Chantegrive L'Origine  (Graves)

Description: The top wine from this estate, this is densely textured and rich with dry tannins and juicy black-plum-skin flavors. The wine has weight, concentration and a fine future. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de la Grave 2016 Caractère  (Côtes de Bourg)

Description: This wine falls just on the right side of too much wood aging. The fruit is dense and powerful enough to cope with the toastiness, but it will take time for the wine to integrate fully. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Beauvillage 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Médoc)

Description: Still showing its wood aging, this wine nevertheless has a balanced future. Black-currant fruits from the blend of four grapes, including Petit Verdot and Malbec, are bold with flavor and ripe acidity. Drink this wine from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Bessan Ségur 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Médoc)

Description: Firm and tannic, this wine needs to soften. Its dense structure is very much in control, although the black fruits are there. It needs time, so drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de la Grave 2018  Côtes de Bourg

Description: Tight, gritty aromas of tire rubber, asphalt and lemony oak comprise a pointy nose. A hard and narrow palate shows a mix of rocky tannins and choppy acidity, while dark-berry flavors play out on an alert finish. This is Cabernet Sauvignon with smaller amounts of Malbec and Petit Verdot.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Kaiken 2018 Terroir Series Cabernet Sauvignon-Malbec-Petit Verdot Red (Los Chacayes)

Description: Richness in this blend comes from the 90% of Merlot, which brings rich blackberry-jam flavors laced with acidity. The structure and ripeness suggest the wine will be ready soon. Drink this ripe, attractive wine from late 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Guillou 2018  Montagne-Saint-Émilion

Description: A rich, perfumed wine from an estate owned by the Lesgourgues family that also produces Armagnac. The wine is juicy and with an attractive freshness and bright fruitiness. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château le Bonnat 2018  Graves

Description: This wine has a dry core that shows strongly beside the black-currant flavors. It is generous, with good potential in the fruitiness stakes as well as plenty of structure for aging. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Peyreblanque 2018 Medeville Collection  (Graves)

Description: This is a rich, Merlot-dominated wine, with generous tannins and structure. Youthful juicy black fruits are perfumed, fragrant with acidity and a succulent texture. Drink this wine from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Féret-Lambert 2018 Costes du Château Féret-Lambert  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

Description: This estate close to Castillon has produced a tight, spicy and structured wine. Rich tannins are still working through the wine, giving it the density to age. The wine will be at its best from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Ribebon 2018 Tradition  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

Appellation: Côtes de Bergerac, Southwest France, France
Description: A soft and fruity blend of Merlot and Malbec, this wine is lightly textured, with red-berry fruits and vibrant acidity. The wine is still young, packed with fruitiness that can be enjoyed now, although it will be even better from 2022. Organic.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Tour des Gendres 2019 Cuvée des Conti Red (Côtes de Bergerac)

Description: A dark-purple color and reduced aromas of wild berry fruits and black olive are earthy and a bit funky. A jammy palate is naturally plump but wayward, without much tannic structure. Mixed berry flavors are jammy and wild, with a baking spice offset. On the finish, this blend of Malbec with 11% Merlot and Cabernet Franc offers hints of freshly ground nutmeg and cocoa.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Alpamanta 2018 Campal Red (Mendoza)

Description: This is a stylish wine from the central Médoc close to Margaux. Finely wrought tannins support black-currant fruits. Drink this attractive wine that has potential balance from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Cap l'Ousteau 2018  Haut-Médoc

Description: This property of the Pagès family has given us an attractively fruity wine. Tannins are still young and the black-currant fruit is still fresh and juicy. This half-and-half blend of Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon will develop well, ready from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château la Roque de By 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Médoc)

Description: A modern, polished style of wine, this offers rich tannins, aromatic wood flavors and a good structure. The density and concentration will take some time to soften, so drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Tour de Castres 2018  Graves

Description: This wine from a 44-acre estate close to the Gironde estuary is rich in jammy black fruit from the Merlot in the blend. There is plenty of structure as well, giving the wine a chance to age. Drink this attractive wine from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château du Moulin Rouge 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Haut-Médoc)

Description: The Secret family has produced a firm wine, structured with tannins but also with a serious weight of fruit. High alcohol doesn't seem a problem with this wine because of its fresh, bright black currants. It will age and smooth out, so wait until 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château la Chandellière 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Médoc)

Description: A rich, Cabernet Sauvignon-dominated wine, this is spicy, hinting at the wood aging but packed with full, ripe blackberry flavors. Tannins and fruit are developing in parallel, and the wine will be ready from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château le Temple 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Médoc)

Description: Smoky and strongly toasty, this wine has a firm structure. The blackberry fruits are a hint in the distance, but they are there and will begin to show their juicy attractiveness. It is worth waiting for this wine. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Magneau 2018  Graves

Description: The Secret family has produced a firm wine, structured with tannins but also with a serious weight of fruit. High alcohol doesn't seem a problem with this wine because of its fresh, bright black currants. It will age and smooth out, so wait until 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château la Chandellière 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Médoc)

Description: A rich, Cabernet Sauvignon-dominated wine, this is spicy, hinting at the wood aging but packed with full, ripe blackberry flavors. Tannins and fruit are developing in parallel, and the wine will be ready from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château le Temple 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Médoc)

Description: Smoky and strongly toasty, this wine has a firm structure. The blackberry fruits are a hint in the distance, but they are there and will begin to show their juicy attractiveness. It is worth waiting for this wine. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Magneau 2018  Graves

Description: With almost equal proportions of Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon, this wine is classic. Touched by wood, but with the fruit very much up front, the wine has richness, a smoky character and promise. Drink this ripe wine from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Noaillac 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Médoc)

Description: This Merlot-dominated wine offers solid black fruits and rich tannins. It suffers a little from the high alcohol and bitter extraction flavors, with hope that these go as the wine ages. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Sergant 2018  Lalande de Pomerol

Description: Well placed in the village of Listrac, this is a fourth-generation estate. This wine's rich tannins are typical of the appellation, underlying the dense black-plum fruits and complex structure. The wine will age well and firmly. Drink from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Vieux Moulin 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Listrac-Médoc)

Appellation: Côtes de Bergerac, Southwest France, France
Description: Dominated by structured, perfumed Cabernet Sauvignon, this wine is juicy with acidity and rich with wood-aged black fruits and generous tannins. The wine is for aging and will be ready to drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Le Clos du Breil 2018 Expression Red (Côtes de Bergerac)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Cola and Dr Pepper spice aromas meet with dark cherry and oregano on the complex nose of this bottling. The cola spice is strong on the palate as well, where cappuccino, star anise, nutmeg and bay leaf also arise, alongside dry notes of cocoa.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Broadside 2018 Printers Alley Red (Paso Robles)

Description: This estate owned by the Castel family is starting to show its real potential. The wine has fine tannins and elegant black fruits, encased in a structure that will allow the wine to age. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château d'Arcins 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Haut-Médoc)

Description: The power of the Merlot in this wine is palpable. It is not a shy wine, instead packed with black fruits and solid, rich tannins. The wine has concentration and power, just spoiled by the bite of alcohol at the end. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Haut Chatain 2018  Lalande de Pomerol

Description: Reflecting the comparative lightness of the vintage, this wine has open blackberry fruits and tannins that are just beginning to soften. It will develop into smooth wine as it matures. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Haut Coteau 2017  Saint-Estèphe

Description: Almost half-and-half Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon with just a touch of Cabernet Franc, this wine is ripe, firm with smoky black fruits and solid tannins. The tannins of the year are still in place and likely to remain but the weight of fruit gives contrast and balance. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Haut-Logat 2016 Cru Bourgeois  (Haut-Médoc)

Description: The 55% Cabernet Sauvignon and the 14 months in wood have produced a wine that has good balance and potential. Black-currant flavors are still firmly in thrall to tannins that will surely soften. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château la Lauzette Declercq 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Haut-Médoc)

Description: This is a lean wine, with fresh black currant fruits and a light touch of tannins. Brightness is enhanced by acidity and the perfumed aftertaste. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château la Tour de By 2017 Cuvée Héritage  (Médoc)

Description: This wine is rich and concentrated. Powerful tannins and a dense texture are supported by solid blackberry fruits. The wine will take time to develop to drinkabilty, so wait until 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Lagrange 2018  Graves

Description: This vibrant wine is packed with blackberry flavors. While the wood aging shows strongly at this stage, that will subside as the fruitiness makes its presence felt. This full, generous wine will be ready to drink from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Landat 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Haut-Médoc)

Description: This structured and firm wine shows bold tannins and rich black fruits. Spice from wood aging mingles with the juicy acidity and powerful texture. The edge of extraction does spoil the wine, but it could dissipate. Wait until 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Liversan 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Haut-Médoc)

Description: This ripe and spicy wine shows plenty of wood-aging flavors while not leaving any of the rich black-currant fruits behind. The wine is full, typically generous for the vintage, and has a good future. Drink from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Puy Castera 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Haut-Médoc)

Description: This structured wine has firm tannins under the luscious blackberry fruits. Acidity and touches of spice bring balance and richness. The wine should age well, filling out the tannins over the next months. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Tour de Calens 2018  Graves

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Cola and Dr Pepper spice aromas meet with dark cherry and oregano on the complex nose of this bottling. The cola spice is strong on the palate as well, where cappuccino, star anise, nutmeg and bay leaf also arise, alongside dry notes of cocoa.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Broadside 2018 Printers Alley Red (Paso Robles)

Description: This estate owned by the Castel family is starting to show its real potential. The wine has fine tannins and elegant black fruits, encased in a structure that will allow the wine to age. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château d'Arcins 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Haut-Médoc)

Description: This wine comes from a vineyard to the north of Saint-Émilion. Ripe tannins and attractive black-currant fruits suggest a wine that will develop easily and quickly. An integrated structure contrasts with the final freshness. Drink from 2022. Organic.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Grand Français 2018 Grande Cuvée  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

Description: Produced by the cooperative in neighboring Listrac, this wine is spicy and packed with wood-aging flavors that hopefully will integrate better. Black-currant fruits provide sustenance and weight behind the tannins. Let the wine age and drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Guitignan 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Moulis-en-Médoc)

Description: This estate in the heart of the Entre-deux-Mers region has produced a perfumed and fruity wine. Although a little young at the moment, it offers ripe black fruits, acidity and light tannins. This polished wine will be ready from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château La Rose Montauran 2018  Bordeaux

Description: This wine is dry, the tannins still dominant. But it will soften, bringing out some fruitiness. But the black-currant flavors are light, leaving tight acidity at the end. Drink from late 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château la Tour de By 2017  Médoc

Description: This wine is superrich, heavy on the alcohol initially but then showing layers of black fruits, rich tannins and some aging potential. As the wine comes together it is likely to coalesce around the rich black-plum and spice flavors. Drink from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Laforge 2018  Saint-Émilion

Description: A rich and juicy wine with a fine future, this is full of berry fruits and still-young, firm tannins. Wood aging does show at the moment but the rich fruit will allow everything to come together. Drink the wine from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château l'Argenteyre 2016 Cru Bourgeois  (Médoc)

Description: The Pez plateau close to the village of Saint-Estèphe is home to many estates that use its name. This wine with its solid texture and bold tannins is richly fruity while having a dry, dense core. It will be ready from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Tour de Pez 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Saint-Estèphe)

Description: Beginning to show its age, this wine is still attractively balanced. Its maturity is expressed in spiciness that is balanced by a dry edge as well as a vegetal flavor. This wine is totally ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Canon Chaigneau 2012  Lalande de Pomerol

Appellation: Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: This ripe, wood-aged wine is just ready to drink. It has the lightness of the vintage, with blackberry fruits and attractive acidity. Tannins give backbone but are now fully integrated. Drink now or wait until late 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de Malherbes 2017  Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux

Description: A rich and juicy wine with a fine future, this is full of berry fruits and still-young, firm tannins. Wood aging does show at the moment but the rich fruit will allow everything to come together. Drink the wine from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château l'Argenteyre 2016 Cru Bourgeois  (Médoc)

Description: The Pez plateau close to the village of Saint-Estèphe is home to many estates that use its name. This wine with its solid texture and bold tannins is richly fruity while having a dry, dense core. It will be ready from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Tour de Pez 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Saint-Estèphe)

Description: This full, ripe and juicy wine is full of balanced blackberry fruits. Tannins support this bright fruitiness while marching with the acidity towards some good aging. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château du Mouret 2018 Medeville Collection  (Graves)

Description: In the heart of the Médoc and close to the Gironde estuary, this vineyard has produced a wine solidly based on dry, firm tannins. Blackberry fruits emphasize the rich texture. The wine will certainly age, and should be ready from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Lacour Jacquet 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Haut-Médoc)

Description: This softly textured wine is spicy, with some smokiness to go with the black fruits. A core of tannins is maturing behind the vibrant fruit. Drink this wine from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Saint-Hilaire 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Médoc)

Description: The lightness of this vintage is apparent in the black-currant fruits and dry core of this wine. It is not likely to develop very far, but is attractive to drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Altimar 2017  Lalande de Pomerol

Description: This wine reflects the vintage, showing bold black fruits and high alcohol. It is full bodied, generous to a fault with succulent flavors and a well-integrated texture. Drink now to revel in the exuberant fruits, or age until 2022 to get a softer, broader view.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Bois Pertuis 2018  Bordeaux

Description: Fruity and soft, this is already an attractive wine. Unoaked and unfined, it has light tannins that are coming together with fresh black-currant fruits. The wine will be ready from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Coustaut 2018  Graves

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of chocolate and cherry lead to soft fruit flavors. There's a lot of structure surrounding them, upping the interest. Decant if drinking in the near term.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Chasing Rain 2018 Red (Red Mountain)

Description: Owned by the Touchais family originally from Anjou in the Loire, this estate is now in its third generation. The wine is spicy, showing dry tannins that are sure to soften. It will mature into a full wine, structured and ready to drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Balac 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Haut-Médoc)

Description: This smoky, spicy wine is still young. Wood-aging flavors show more strongly than the perfumed black fruits but that will change. It has a good future, so drink from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Canon Chaigneau 2018  Lalande de Pomerol

Description: This bottling is a ripe and fruity wine that has soft tannins and plenty of fresh black-damson-plum flavors. The structure is fully integrated already, promising early drinking. Drink from late 2021. Organic and biodynamic.                      Roger Voss
Designation: La Tour Chambert Cuvée des Hauts Coteaux
Name: Château de Chambert 2019 La Tour Chambert Cuvée des Hauts Coteaux  (Cahors)

Description: Owned by the Touchais family originally from Anjou in the Loire, this estate is now in its third generation. The wine is spicy, showing dry tannins that are sure to soften. It will mature into a full wine, structured and ready to drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Balac 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Haut-Médoc)

Description: This smoky, spicy wine is still young. Wood-aging flavors show more strongly than the perfumed black fruits but that will change. It has a good future, so drink from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Canon Chaigneau 2018  Lalande de Pomerol

Description: This bottling is a ripe and fruity wine that has soft tannins and plenty of fresh black-damson-plum flavors. The structure is fully integrated already, promising early drinking. Drink from late 2021. Organic and biodynamic.                      Roger Voss
Designation: La Tour Chambert Cuvée des Hauts Coteaux
Name: Château de Chambert 2019 La Tour Chambert Cuvée des Hauts Coteaux  (Cahors)

Description: A dry wine, this is textured while also having a light touch. Black-currant fruits are beginning to show promise and release their perfumed character. Drink this balanced wine from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de l'Annonciation 2017  Saint-Émilion

Description: While superripe Merlot dominates this wine, the finer structure of the Cabernet Franc add shape and firmness. The wine will age well. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de Monturon 2018  Saint-Émilion

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Cabernet Sauvignon makes up 70% of this wine, with the rest Merlot (14%) and near equal parts Petit Verdot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Malbec. The aromas bring notes of dried herbs, celery salt and dried cherry. Tire rubber and cherry flavors follow, with the tannins showing some astringency.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Elevation Cellars 2013 Monolith Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: While you can taste the wood aging in this wine, there is also plenty of potential fruitiness to balance. The black-currant flavors, spice and acidity mean the wine will be ready from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine du Salut 2018  Graves

Description: Ripe and perfumed, this is an unusual wine, with 80% Cabernet Franc. It comes from the region of Castillon in the east of Bordeaux. Red berries are allied to a smoky character and spice from wood aging in a rich wine that will age further. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de Ribebon 2018 Cabernet Franc  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

Description: In the southern Médoc, this 10-acre estate has produced an open, softly fruity wine. The tannins and the wood aging offer structure to support the black fruits and fresh acidity. This wine will be ready from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Bellegrave du Poujeau 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Haut-Médoc)

Description: This estate close to Listrac has produced a wine that shares some of the firm tannins of that appellation. Dark and with a strong structure, this wine will take time to develop. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Bibian 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Haut-Médoc)

Description: Packed with richness, this Merlot-dominated wine has perfumed black fruits shot through with dark tannins. It will take time to soften and fully integrate. Drink from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château la Commanderie 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Saint-Estèphe)

Description: This wine comes from a 118-acre estate. It is stalky, with closed black fruits that need time to soften and smooth out. Likewise, the tannin structure is still dry and also needs time. But this wine has a future. Wait to drink until 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château la Gorce 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Médoc)

Description: Aged only in tank, this wine celebrates its rich fruitiness. The solid tannins of the Malbec come through strongly and ripely, bringing with them powerful dark fruits, acidity, spice and concentration. The wine needs time, so drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Lamartine 2018 Prestige du Malbec  (Cahors)

Description: This ripe, spicy wine is full of black-currant fruits. It has a layer of firm tannins as well as hints of wood-aging flavors. All these elements will come together well as the wine matures. It will be worth waiting until 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Poitevin 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Médoc)

Description: This estate in Cissac, north of Saint-Estèphe, has produced a ripe and structured wine that balances fresh black fruitiness and acidity with a core of dry tannins. The shape of the wine and its finely wrought texture promise good aging. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Vieux Landat 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Haut-Médoc)

Description: This 25-acre estate has been owned by the same family since 1840. Its latest release is structured and full of dry tannins, but with the promise of balanced black-fruit flavors. It will take time to develop and should not be drunk before 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Vieux Robin 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Médoc)

Description: Big and ripe, this is a full-bodied, generous wine. Rich blackberry fruits and dark tannins burst with energy and juicy acidity. Drink the wine from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Doms 2018  Graves

Description: Bottled without added sulfur, this wine has a firm, dry structure. It suffers from a metallic edge that perhaps just reflects its youth. The wine needs more time to soften, so wait to drink until 2023. Organic.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château du Cèdre 2019 Extra Libre  (Cahors)

Description: The tannins are dense and richly concentrated in this blackberry-flavored, structured wine. It is obviously very young, showing its wood aging as well as succulent fruits and acidity. The wine will take its time, so drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Camus 2018  Graves

Description: This estate, inland from the Gironde, has produced a ripe, generously textured and black-currant-flavored wine. It is full, spicy with a touch of pepper and bursting with young tannins and fruit. Drink the wine from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Clément Saint-Jean 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Médoc)

Description: This wine shows structure and firm tannins from the Cabernet Sauvignon in the blend. It has concentration as well as brighter blackberry fruits that are still fresh but ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Haut-Liloie 2016  Bordeaux Supérieur

Description: With 80% Merlot and equal quantities of the two Cabernets, this wine is young, spicy and rich with black-currant flavors and tannins. The wine's structure and smoky character point to aging. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Jacquet de la Grave 2019  Bordeaux

Description: Ripe and dense with opulence as well as big tannins, this classic Cahors is deliciously rich. It has 85% Malbec with a touch of Merlot that has softened the structure and brought out the fruit. Drink from late 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Nozières 2018  Cahors

Description: This long-established vineyard has produced a wood-aged wine, ripe with red fruits and still structured with a core of dry tannins. With a high percentage of Merlot in the blend, it is succulent, full bodied and shows its alcohol. It will be ready to drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Peychaud 2018  Côtes de Bourg

Description: Named after the Dupré family, this estate to the west of Listrac has produced a strict, tannic wine. Rich tannins are in danger of overwhelming the fruits. Time will tell, but the wine certainly needs time. Wait to drink until 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Saransot-Dupré 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Listrac-Médoc)

Description: Big and ripe, this is a full-bodied, generous wine. Rich blackberry fruits and dark tannins burst with energy and juicy acidity. Drink the wine from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Doms 2018  Graves

Description: Bottled without added sulfur, this wine has a firm, dry structure. It suffers from a metallic edge that perhaps just reflects its youth. The wine needs more time to soften, so wait to drink until 2023. Organic.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château du Cèdre 2019 Extra Libre  (Cahors)

Description: With its soft tannins and balance between black fruits and structure, this generous, open wine is developing well. The fruitiness, spice and wood-aging flavors are still young. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine La Roche 2018  Pessac-Léognan

Description: Firm, dry and showing some signs of extraction, this is a richly worked wine. Solid and dense in the center and paired with black fruits, the wine is full bodied and suffers from a burn of pepper from the high alcohol. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château des Graves 2018  Graves

Description: From an estate owned by negociant Cheval Quancard, this second wine is lightly spicy while also structured and firm from tannins that lie behind the blackberry fruits. Rich and with a solid, dry core, the wine is developing well, ready from late 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Haut-Logat 2016 Haut-Galot  (Haut-Médoc)

Description: A fresh wine that has a core of firm, ageworthy tannins, this shows fruitiness before dryness. It should age well and quickly.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château La Rose Sarron 2018  Graves

Description: At 98% Merlot, this wine is packed with rich black fruits and the beginnings of jammy richness. There are still tannins to soften and an oxidative edge to disappear before the wine is ready. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Perthus 2018  Côtes de Bourg

Description: From a property belonging to the Dubourdieu family, this wine is the baby brother of Clos Floridène. Light and fruity with attractive black-currant flavors, the wine still has some dryness but that will go shortly. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Haura 2018  Graves

Description: Unusually there is a small percentage of Malbec in this wine. It is fruity ,with fresh black-currant flavors as well as juicy acidity. Drink this attractive wine from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château la Ribaud 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Médoc)

Description: This fresh, ripe wine shows spicy wood-aging flavors as well as black-currant fruits. The wood aging needs to integrate better before the wine will be ready to drink. Wait until 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château les Tresquots 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Médoc)

Description: Young and somewhat rustic, this blend of Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon has blackberry fruits and a bitter edge of tannins. The future is suggested by fruitiness and acidity at the end. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Saint-Robert 2019  Graves

Description: Aromas of strawberry, dark chocolate and cinnamon start this easy-drinking Cabernet-Merlot blend. Plush tannins and flavors of blueberry, cherry, smoke, soft spice and plum give it widespread appeal.                      Susan Kostrzewa
Name: Amalagos 2018 Plóes Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot (Drama)

Description: From land originally planted to vines by the Romans, this wine is smoky, dense and blackly rich. Bold plum fruits and tannins that are on the cusp of softening are the prominent features of this mainly Merlot wine. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Croix Mouton 2019  Bordeaux Supérieur

Description: A soft, attractively fruity wine, this is fresh with black currants and plenty of acidity. While it is young and could age, it is best to appreciate it now with the fruitiness right up front.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de Bordes-Quancard 2018  Bordeaux

Description: Dominated by Merlot supported by 20% Petit Verdot, this rich, densely textured blend shows powerful tannins. Dark chocolate and licorice flavors suggest firm extraction that gives the wine a dry character. Everything needs to open, but the elements are there. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château L'Ermitage 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Listrac-Médoc)

Description: This smooth, velvet-textured wine is rich and advancing well. Tannins and black fruits have been softened by wood aging to give a generous wine that will be attractive from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Vieux Pourret 2018  Saint-Émilion

Description: With no added sulfur, this wine has a slight metallic edge along with bright cherry flavors that are fresh and packed with fruitiness. The wine needs a little time to open out fully, so drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Cantelaudette 2019 San Soufre Ajouté  (Graves de Vayres)

Description: This smooth, velvet-textured wine is rich and advancing well. Tannins and black fruits have been softened by wood aging to give a generous wine that will be attractive from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Vieux Pourret 2018  Saint-Émilion

Description: Softly textured, fruity and young, this is a generous blend of a majority Cabernet Franc with Merlot. The wine is all blackberry flavors, with a hint of smokiness. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Haut Boutisse 2019  Bordeaux

Description: This wine is rich and firm, with solid dry tannins. The wine's weight indicates fruitiness in its future as the tannins soften. That will take time, so drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Mayne du Cros 2018  Graves

Description: With a fresh, juicy character, this wine is bright, full of black-currant fruits and fresh acidity. With its light texture and tannins, the wine will age quickly. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Moulin de Canhaut 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Médoc)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is 68% Cabernet Sauvignon, 13% Merlot, 10% Petit Verdot, 5% Cabernet Franc and 4% Malbec. The aromas bring notes of fresh garden herbs, hay, cocoa, cherry and dark chocolate. Despite the age, the palate is bunched up and short. It brings surprising acidity given the warmth of the vintage.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Elevation Cellars 2013 Jammin' Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Produced in the Entre-deux-Mers, this wine is perfumed and lightly structured, with attractive, ripe wood-aged black-currant flavors. It is fruity but with a texture that gives shape as well as accessibility. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Kirkland Signature 2018  Bordeaux Supérieur

Description: Produced in the Entre-deux-Mers, this wine is perfumed and lightly structured, with attractive, ripe wood-aged black-currant flavors. It is fruity but with a texture that gives shape as well as accessibility. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Kirkland Signature 2018  Bordeaux Supérieur

Description: In this perfumed wine, serious layers of wood aging currently mask the black-currant fruits. There is enough weight to give potential richness and freshness, promising a balanced wine. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Boyrein 2018  Graves

Description: Produced by the cooperative of Listrac, this wine comes from a family-owned estate. The wine has a dry core and hints of the wood aging. Black-fruit flavors with a majority of jammy Merlot contrast with firm tannins that will soften. The wine will be ready from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Capdet 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Listrac-Médoc)

Description: The 90% Merlot in this wine gives richness while the high alcohol brings in a burn of pepper on the palate. Black fruits are rich, dense and packed with juicy acidity to contrast with the bold structure. The wine will be ready from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château la France Delhomme 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Médoc)

Description: With 61% Cabernet Sauvignon, this blend is well structured and layered with tannins and fresh blackberry fruits. A dry core needs to soften, so wait until 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Saint Ahon 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Haut-Médoc)

Description: This wine is richly textured, with both ripe tannins and generous black fruits. Offering spice, black-currant flavors and fresh acidity at the end, this very drinkable wine will be ready soon. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de Villambis 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Haut-Médoc)

Description: Dry and dense, this wine has firm tannins that suggest heavy extraction. That should dissipate although tannins that dry could well persist. Try the wine from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Jouvente 2018 La Source de Jouvente  (Graves)

Description: An open, lightly spicy and fruity wine, this is fresh with black currants. The wood aging is just right, giving vanilla to go with the fruitiness. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Baron la Rose 2018  Bordeaux

Description: This simple fruity wine is lightly spicy, with plenty of blackberry fruits. Although tannins are up front at this stage they will soon give way to the wine's natural fruitiness. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Ladignac 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Médoc)

Description: This big, rich wine is solid with ripe Merlot fruits and dense tannins. The wine does have some juiciness, but its weight and pepper edge from alcohol spoil the blackberry fruits. Drink the wine from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Bournac 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Médoc)

Description: This wine is dry, with touches of bitter extraction that lessen the fruitiness and balance. While it will soften, it seems the wine will remain dry.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de Beau-Site 2018  Graves

Description: This bright, ripe and soft wine shows the richness of the vintage. The open texture brings out the red fruits and acidity. It is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de Bernardon 2018  Bordeaux

Description: This bright, ripe and soft wine shows the richness of the vintage. The open texture brings out the red fruits and acidity. It is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de Bernardon 2018  Bordeaux

Description: Heavy wood aging mars this wine. It confers a toasty character, aromas of freshly sawn planks and leaves little room for the fruit. The fruit is there, but unlikely to get much of a chance.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de Landiras 2018  Graves

Description: A high proportion of Merlot gives this wine a juicy, jammy character that dominates the core of tannins and the spicy, grilled-almond flavors. The wine will develop quickly, so drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Haut Barrail 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Médoc)

Description: Although this wine is fruity, the tannins and wood-aging toastiness show most strongly. The wine has some future but it is likely to be a dry, firm one.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Méric 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Médoc)

Description: This vineyard in the Entre-deux-Mers region has given a rich and full, black-fruited wine. Ripe tannins are lifted by acidity although the aftertaste does leave the pepper and bitterness of high alcohol. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Moulin de la Faye 2018  Bordeaux

Description: This wine lacks focus. Attractive black fruits are a bit lost in the welter of dry tannins and extraction.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Pont de Brion 2018  Graves

Description: From an estate close to Gironde estuary, this wine has tannins that are already softening, giving fresh fruitiness and lightly perfumed acidity. Aged partly in wood, the wine will develop quickly. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Roquegrave 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Médoc)

Description: Shadowed by tannins and with a powerful structure, this wine may have too much dryness for its own good. It is hard to discern the fruit under the extraction and wood aging.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Venus 2018  Graves

Description: From one of the estates owned by the Bouey family, this wine has richness as well as straight, taut structure. The combination, tough at this stage, promises well and the wine should be drunk from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Maison Blanche 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Médoc)

Description: This wine shows its alcoholic weight and has an austere, tannic character. The wine is dry and needs more fruitiness to blossom.                      Roger Voss
Name: Marquis De Bern 2018  Graves

Description: There was probably over-enthusiastic wood aging in this wine that suffers from heavy toastiness. Fruit has been submerged by spice and smokiness. While the balance will be restored, there will always be this residue of wood flavors.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château La Branne 2018 Cru Bourgeois  (Médoc)

Description: This estate in the Entre-deux-Mers about 30 miles from Bordeaux has produced a wine that has attractive black-currant fruits, fresh acidity and a medium-term potential. Young now, it will be ready to drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Vieux Manoir 2019  Bordeaux
